title: Nvidia denies Chinese claims of hidden access mechanisms in its H20 chips
body: Nvidia has denied allegations that its H20 artificial intelligence chips contain hidden “backdoors” that could enable remote, unauthorized access or control. The statement follows concerns China’s Cyberspace Administration (CAC) raised over possible security vulnerabilities in the company’s AI products. “Cybersecurity is critically important to us,” a Nvidia spokesperson told FOX Business in an email. “ Nvidia does not have ‘backdoors’ in our chips that would give anyone a remote way to access or control them.” Sources familiar with the matter said the H20 chip was discussed in a closed-door meeting between Nvidia representatives and the Chinese internet regulator. The discussions reportedly centered on fears that US-made chips might be designed to monitor users or bypass data privacy safeguards—concerns amplified by recent legislative proposals in the United States. Backdoors are undiscovered capabilities or vulnerabilities in hardware or software that ca n be used to g ain un authorized access. Beijing fears such mechanisms could lurk in foreign technology, particularly high-performance computing chips central to national infrastructure. US plan to track foreign visitors alarms other nations China’s worries deepened last month when news reports said the United States considered adding location-tracking or verification capabilities to semiconductors sold to other countries. It has been floated both in the White House and by lawmakers to boost national security and keep an eye on how chips are used beyond its borders. No legislation has been passed, but the idea has been thrown by foreign governments, particularly China, which views such things as potential surveillance tools. Chinese officials are concerned these capabilities would enable US agencies to listen in on, or even sabotage, Chinese networks . The concerns have been focused on privacy and national security, since businesses, military applications, universities, and AI research labs throughout China employ Nvidia’s chips. China has a history of testing technology brought in from the United States on security grounds. In 2023, for example, the government reportedly ordered critical infrastructure operators not to buy American memory chips from US-based Micron for national security reasons. Nvidia weighs goals against geopolitics The race between the United States and China to create the world’s first global computing network has intensified. And Nvidia is a big loser. Due to rules imposed by the US Department of Commerce, the company’s flagship H20 AI chip had been prohibited from being sold in China earlier this year. The restrictions were much broader as part of a continuing effort to restrict China’s access to advanced technologies that the administration considers necessary for its military and surveillance systems. The limitations were a major blow to Nvidia’s earnings and cost it billions of dollars in potential sales. However, that changed suddenly earlier this month, when the US lifted a year-old ban after a private meeting between President Donald Trump and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang. The reversal was part of a broader mineral deal in which China agreed to ease its export restrictions on rare earth elements — materials crucial to semiconductor and electric vehicle manufacturing. That settlement permitted Nvidia to ship the H20 chip to Chinese buyers again, a development that investors and industry participants hailed. China is a major market for Nvidia, and demand for AI chips has soared as the country has grown quickly in tech. Despite the policy shift, the company continues under pressure to satisfy compliance requirem ents from both governments. Nvidia has to convince American officials and Chin ese r egulators that its chips won’t serve adversarial nations and assure China t hat th e same chips aren’t Trojan horses for surveillance. Still, Nvidia’s leadership has aligned itself with US ambitions to dominate the AI race. In an interview last week, the company’s CEO lauded the Trump administration’s AI roadmap, channeling a report that could accelerate technological progress and consolid ate Am erica’s tech leadership on the global st age. title: Hyperliquid Integrates Circle’s USDC and CCTP V2 to Boost DeFi Ecosystem
body: Circle confirmed native USDC and CCTP V2 integration on Hyperliquid, supporting faster cross-chain USDC transfers. Hyperliquid captured 70% of USDC on Arbitrum, with AUM rising from under $4B to $5.5B. HYPE token traded at $43.97, holding above the 50-day EMA and showing neutral RSI near 52. Circle confirmed the upcoming launch of native USDC and CCTP V2 bridging protocol on the Hyperliquid blockchain. Hyperliquid is a high-performance blockchain that combines a native order book DEX (HyperCore) with a smart contract platform (HyperEVM). The integration will allow native USDC to be deployed on HyperEVM for direct use in trading and across all of its applications. Native USDC, issued by Circle’s regulated affiliates, maintains a 1:1 redemption with U.S. dollars and gives institutional users access to Circle Mint for compliant on- and off-ramps. CCTP V2 to help seamless USDC transfers Alongside native USDC, the launch of CCTP V2 will bring cross-chain transfer functionality. This will let you move USDC between Hyperliquid and other blockchains with full capital efficiency, eliminating the risks of using wrapped or synthetic tokens. title: Hong Kong Stablecoin: Revolutionary Era of Digital Asset Regulation Begins
body: BitcoinWorld Hong Kong Stablecoin: Revolutionary Era of Digital Asset Regulation Begins Hong Kong just made a monumental move in the world of digital finance. As of August 1st, the city’s new Stablecoins Ordinance is officially in effect, marking a pivotal moment for the future of Hong Kong Stablecoin and the broader crypto landscape. This isn’t just another regulatory update; it’s a comprehensive framework designed to bring stability, transparency, and trust to a rapidly evolving sector. For anyone involved in digital assets, from seasoned investors to curious newcomers, understanding this shift is absolutely crucial. Understanding the New Hong Kong Stablecoin Ordinance So, what exactly does this new ordinance entail? In essence, Hong Kong has introduced a robust licensing regime specifically targeting Hong Kong dollar–backed stablecoins. As reported by JinSe Finance, citing CCTV, this means that any entity issuing stablecoins that are pegged to the Hong Kong dollar, and operating either within or from Hong Kong, must now obtain a license from the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA). This move positions Hong Kong at the forefront of global efforts to regulate digital assets, ensuring that the burgeoning market operates under a clear, accountable framework. The core objective is clear: to strengthen oversight. Historically, stablecoins have operated in a somewhat gray area, leading to concerns about transparency, reserves, and potential systemic risks. By implementing a formal licensing system, the HKMA aims to mitigate these risks, providing a secure environment for innovation and growth. It’s a proactive step that demonstrates Hong Kong’s commitment to fostering a responsible and secure digital asset ecosystem. Why is Hong Kong Stablecoin Regulation Crucial for the Market? You might be wondering, why is this level of regulation so important, especially for a rapidly evolving asset class like Hong Kong Stablecoin ? The answer lies in fostering trust and stability. Without clear rules, stablecoins, despite their name, can be anything but stable. Here’s why this regulatory move is a game-changer: Investor Protection: The primary goal is to safeguard consumers and investors. By requiring issuers to meet stringent standards, the HKMA ensures that stablecoins are genuinely backed by reserves and that redemption mechanisms are reliable. This protects users from potential losses due to opaque practices or insufficient backing. Financial Stability: Large-scale stablecoin failures could potentially ripple through the broader financial system. By bringing stablecoins under regulatory purview, the HKMA aims to prevent such systemic risks, ensuring that these digital assets integrate safely into the traditional financial infrastructure. Combating Illicit Activities: Stronger oversight means better compliance with Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Counter-Terrorist Financing (CTF) requirements. Licensed entities will be required to implement robust AML/CTF controls, making it harder for illicit funds to flow through the stablecoin ecosystem. This enhances the integrity of Hong Kong’s financial system as a whole. Fostering Responsible Innovation: While regulation might sometimes seem like a hindrance, in the long run, it creates a more predictable and trustworthy environment. This certainty can attract more institutional players and foster responsible innovation, as businesses know the rules of engagement and can build sustainable models. This comprehensive approach by the HKMA underscores its expertise in financial oversight and its commitment to building a robust, trustworthy digital asset market. Key Requirements for Hong Kong Stablecoin Issuers: What Do They Need to Do? The new ordinance lays out clear, non-negotiable requirements for entities wishing to issue Hong Kong Stablecoin . These standards are designed to ensure that stablecoins operate with the highest degree of transparency and security. Here are the core pillars that licensed entities must adhere to: Reserve Management: This is perhaps the most critical aspect. Issuers must maintain sufficient reserves that are held in highly liquid, low-risk assets, separate from their operational funds. This ensures that every stablecoin in circulation is genuinely backed one-to-one, preventing situations like those seen with uncollateralized stablecoins. Transparency: Regular audits and public attestations of reserves will likely be required, providing clear visibility into the backing of each Hong Kong Stablecoin . Redemption Mechanisms: Licensed issuers must ensure that stablecoins can be redeemed at par value for the underlying Hong Kong dollar at any time. This guarantees liquidity and maintains the peg, which is fundamental to a stablecoin’s utility and reliability. Operational Robustness: The redemption process must be efficient and resilient, even during periods of high demand. Asset Segregation: Customer funds and reserves must be strictly segregated from the issuer’s own operational funds. This protects user assets in case of the issuer’s insolvency, a crucial safeguard for consumer protection. Legal Clarity: This segregation ensures that customer assets are not subject to claims from the issuer’s creditors. Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Counter-Terrorist Financing (CTF) Compliance: Issuers must implement robust AML/CTF policies and procedures, including Know Your Customer (KYC) checks for users. This aligns stablecoin operations with global financial crime prevention standards. Reporting Requirements: Suspicious transaction reporting will be mandatory, further strengthening the financial integrity of the ecosystem. Risk Management: Comprehensive risk management frameworks must be in place to identify, assess, and mitigate various risks, including operational, cyber, and market risks. This proactive approach helps prevent disruptions and ensures the stability of the stablecoin. Contingency Planning: Issuers will need robust plans for handling unexpected events, ensuring continuous service and asset safety. Disclosure Requirements: Licensed entities will be obligated to provide clear, accurate, and timely information to the public regarding their operations, reserves, and risk management practices. This enhances transparency and allows users to make informed decisions. User Education: Clear disclosure also contributes to educating users about the nature and risks associated with stablecoins. These requirements highlight the authoritative stance of the HKMA, setting a high bar for market participants and building a foundation of trustworthiness . What’s Next for Hong Kong Stablecoin Supervision? The implementation of the Stablecoins Ordinance is just the beginning. The HKMA has indicated that it will conduct further consultations on detailed supervisory guidelines. This phased approach is common in regulatory development, allowing for flexibility and adaptation as the market evolves and new challenges emerge. These future guidelines will likely delve deeper into the specifics of the requirements, providing more granular instructions for compliance. We can expect ongoing dialogue with industry stakeholders to ensure the regulations remain practical and effective. This iterative process is crucial for striking the right balance between robust oversight and fostering innovation. Hong Kong’s commitment to continuous improvement in its regulatory framework will be key to its success as a leading digital asset hub. The HKMA’s proactive engagement demonstrates its experience in navigating complex financial landscapes. Benefits and Challenges of Hong Kong Stablecoin Oversight Like any significant regulatory shift, the new Hong Kong Stablecoin ordinance comes with both substantial benefits and potential challenges. Benefits: Enhanced Trust and Credibility: A regulated environment instills confidence among institutional investors, traditional financial players, and the general public. This increased trust is vital for wider adoption of stablecoins. Clear Operating Environment: For businesses, clear rules mean reduced uncertainty. This predictability allows companies to invest and innovate with greater confidence, knowing the regulatory boundaries. Global Competitiveness: By establishing a robust framework, Hong Kong positions itself as a secure and reputable jurisdiction for digital asset businesses, potentially attracting more investment and talent. It reinforces Hong Kong’s status as a leading international financial center. Reduced Systemic Risk: The safeguards against insolvency, illiquidity, and illicit activities contribute to the overall stability of the financial system, protecting it from potential shocks originating from the digital asset space. Challenges: Compliance Burden: Meeting the stringent requirements will demand significant resources from stablecoin issuers, particularly smaller entities. This could initially slow down market entry for some. Innovation Stifled (Initially): While long-term benefits include fostering innovation, the initial phase of compliance might lead to a more cautious approach from innovators, as they adapt to the new regulatory landscape. Adapting to Evolving Technology: The digital asset space is incredibly dynamic. Regulators will face the ongoing challenge of keeping pace with technological advancements and ensuring the rules remain relevant and effective. Balancing Act: The HKMA must continually balance the need for robust oversight with the desire to promote innovation and maintain Hong Kong’s competitiveness. Navigating the Future of the Hong Kong Stablecoin Market With the Stablecoins Ordinance now in effect, the landscape for Hong Kong Stablecoin is set for a transformative period. For institutions, this means clearer pathways for integrating stablecoins into their operations, potentially leading to increased adoption for cross-border payments, tokenized assets, and other financial services. Retail users can look forward to greater security and peace of mind when holding or transacting with HKD-backed stablecoins, knowing they are backed by robust regulatory oversight. Hong Kong’s proactive stance is a strong signal of its ambition to become a leading global hub for virtual assets. This move isn’t just about stablecoins; it’s part of a broader strategy to embrace digital finance responsibly. As the HKMA continues its consultations and refines its supervisory guidelines, we can expect a dynamic environment where regulatory clarity fosters responsible growth. The future of the Hong Kong Stablecoin market looks bright, underpinned by a commitment to security, transparency, and innovation. In conclusion, Hong Kong’s new Stablecoins Ordinance is a landmark development, ushering in a revolutionary era for digital asset regulation. By establishing a comprehensive licensing regime for Hong Kong dollar–backed stablecoins, the HKMA is setting a global precedent for responsible innovation. This move enhances investor protection, strengthens financial stability, and positions Hong Kong as a secure and trusted environment for the evolving world of digital finance. It’s a testament to Hong Kong’s foresight and commitment to building a robust, transparent, and trustworthy digital asset ecosystem for the future. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What is the Hong Kong Stablecoins Ordinance? The Hong Kong Stablecoins Ordinance is a new regulatory framework that took effect on August 1, 2023. It introduces a mandatory licensing regime for issuers of Hong Kong dollar-backed stablecoins, requiring them to meet stringent standards for reserve management, redemption, and other operational aspects. Who needs a license under the new Hong Kong Stablecoin regulations? Any entity that issues stablecoins backed by the Hong Kong dollar, and operates either in or from Hong Kong, is now required to obtain a license from the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA). What are the key requirements for Hong Kong Stablecoin issuers under the new ordinance? Licensed issuers must comply with standards for reserve management (ensuring 1:1 backing with liquid assets), redemption (allowing stablecoins to be exchanged for HKD at par), asset segregation (keeping customer funds separate), Anti-Money Laundering (AML), risk management, and disclosure requirements. How will this new regulation impact the broader crypto market in Hong Kong? This regulation is expected to bring greater trust, transparency, and stability to the Hong Kong crypto market, particularly for stablecoins. It may encourage more institutional participation and foster responsible innovation by providing a clear regulatory environment, solidifying Hong Kong’s position as a digital asset hub. Is this regulation only for HKD-backed stablecoins? Yes, the initial focus of the Stablecoins Ordinance is specifically on stablecoins that derive their value from and are pegged to the Hong Kong dollar (HKD). The HKMA may consider expanding the scope in future phases. When will detailed supervisory guidelines for Hong Kong Stablecoin be released? The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) has stated that it will conduct further consultations on detailed supervisory guidelines. While a specific timeline hasn’t been announced, this indicates an ongoing process to refine and provide more granular instructions for compliance. Did you find this article insightful? Share it with your network to help spread awareness about Hong Kong’s pioneering steps in digital asset regulation! To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping stablecoin institutional adoption. title: Cardone Capital Bitcoin: A Bold Strategic Move Amidst Market Volatility
body: BitcoinWorld Cardone Capital Bitcoin: A Bold Strategic Move Amidst Market Volatility In the rapidly evolving landscape of digital finance, institutional players are increasingly making significant moves that reshape market perceptions. One such notable event comes from Cardone Capital, the Florida-based real estate investment powerhouse led by the charismatic Grant Cardone. Their recent announcement of a substantial increase in their Cardone Capital Bitcoin holdings underscores a growing trend: the strategic integration of cryptocurrency into traditional asset portfolios. This isn’t just a simple purchase; it’s a calculated maneuver designed to leverage market dynamics and solidify a long-term vision for their investment strategy. Cardone Capital Bitcoin: A Strategic Acquisition Amidst Market Fluctuations Cardone Capital has once again demonstrated its conviction in digital assets, adding another 100 BTC to its balance sheet. CEO Grant Cardone announced this latest acquisition on X, highlighting the firm’s proactive approach to capitalize on recent dips in Bitcoin’s price. This strategic ‘buying the dip’ tactic is a hallmark of seasoned investors who recognize temporary market corrections as opportunities for accumulation. With this addition, Cardone Capital’s total Bitcoin holdings now stand at approximately 1,100 BTC, marking a significant milestone in their digital asset journey. The firm’s ambition doesn’t stop there. Cardone Capital has publicly outlined an aggressive goal to hold a staggering 4,000 BTC by year-end. This target signals a deep-seated belief in Bitcoin’s future potential and its role as a core component of their diversified investment strategy. Such consistent and targeted acquisitions reinforce the growing legitimacy of institutional Cardone Capital Bitcoin investments within the broader financial ecosystem. Why the Institutional Shift? Understanding Cardone Capital’s Bitcoin Vision The decision by a prominent real estate firm like Cardone Capital to embrace Bitcoin is a compelling indicator of changing investment paradigms. Traditional financial institutions are increasingly recognizing Bitcoin’s unique properties that offer distinct advantages in today’s economic climate. Their motivations are often rooted in a desire for robust diversification and a hedge against macroeconomic uncertainties. Inflation Hedge: Bitcoin’s finite supply (capped at 21 million coins) offers a stark contrast to fiat currencies, which can be subject to inflationary pressures through unlimited printing. This scarcity positions Bitcoin as a potential store of value, akin to ‘digital gold,’ protecting purchasing power over time. Portfolio Diversification: Historically, Bitcoin has shown a low correlation with traditional assets like stocks and bonds. Adding Bitcoin can therefore enhance portfolio diversification, potentially reducing overall risk while improving risk-adjusted returns. Long-Term Growth Potential: Despite its volatility, Bitcoin has demonstrated remarkable growth over the past decade. Institutional investors, operating with longer investment horizons, aim to capture a share of this future appreciation as global digital adoption and infrastructure mature. Technological Innovation: Investing in Bitcoin also represents an investment in blockchain technology itself, which promises to revolutionize various sectors beyond finance. This forward-thinking perspective is crucial for firms aiming to stay competitive in an evolving world. The increasing institutional embrace, epitomized by firms making significant Cardone Capital Bitcoin investments, validates cryptocurrency as a serious asset class, moving beyond speculative retail interest. The Innovative Fund: Real Estate Powering Bitcoin Growth One of the most groundbreaking aspects of Cardone Capital’s strategy is their innovative approach to funding future Bitcoin acquisitions. The firm is preparing to launch a new fund that will be uniquely backed by 10 substantial real estate assets. This ingenious structure creates a fascinating synergy between the tangible stability of real estate and the dynamic growth potential of digital currency. By leveraging income-generating real estate properties, Cardone Capital aims to establish a sustainable and robust mechanism for continuous Bitcoin purchases. This model could offer investors a dual benefit: exposure to the relatively stable returns and foundational security of real estate, combined with the high-growth potential of Bitcoin. It’s a pioneering move that blurs the lines between traditional and digital finance, potentially setting a new precedent for how asset managers approach capital allocation and diversification. The success of this fund could inspire a new wave of hybrid investment vehicles, further integrating Cardone Capital Bitcoin strategies into mainstream finance. Navigating Volatility: Risks and Rewards of Cardone Capital’s Bitcoin Play While the allure of Bitcoin’s potential returns is undeniable, its inherent price volatility remains a significant factor for all investors, including institutions. Bitcoin’s value can experience dramatic fluctuations driven by global economic news, regulatory developments, and shifts in market sentiment. For a firm like Cardone Capital, managing this volatility requires a sophisticated investment philosophy and a long-term commitment. Their ‘buying the dip’ strategy suggests a conviction that current market corrections are temporary deviations from an overall upward trend. This long-term perspective is vital for large-scale institutional holders who view Bitcoin as a foundational asset rather than a short-term trade. The ability to maintain focus on their 4,000 BTC year-end target, despite market swings, showcases their strategic discipline. Key considerations for large institutional Bitcoin investors include: Robust Custody Solutions: Ensuring the secure storage of substantial Bitcoin holdings against cyber threats and theft is paramount, often requiring specialized institutional-grade custody providers. Regulatory Landscape: Navigating the complex and evolving global regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies is crucial for compliance and operational integrity. Market Impact: Large-volume transactions by institutional players can themselves influence market prices, necessitating careful execution strategies to minimize disruption. Cardone Capital’s continued expansion of its Cardone Capital Bitcoin portfolio, even amidst market uncertainty, reinforces the growing confidence in digital assets as a legitimate and valuable component of a comprehensive investment strategy. Actionable Insights for Individual Investors While most individual investors cannot replicate Cardone Capital’s scale, their strategic moves offer valuable lessons applicable to personal portfolios: Adopt a Long-Term Vision: Similar to Cardone Capital’s year-end goal, focus on Bitcoin’s long-term potential rather than short-term price movements. This mindset helps in weathering market volatility. Consider Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA): Instead of trying to time the market, invest a fixed amount regularly. This strategy, akin to Cardone Capital’s consistent acquisitions during dips, averages out your purchase price over time. Diversify Your Portfolio: While Bitcoin can be a powerful asset, ensure your overall portfolio is diversified across various asset classes to manage risk effectively. Conduct Thorough Research: Understand the fundamentals of any asset you invest in. Cardone Capital’s moves are based on extensive analysis; individual investors should do the same. Practice Prudent Risk Management: Only invest capital you are prepared to lose. Bitcoin’s volatility means potential for significant gains, but also for losses. Institutional actions provide insights, but individual financial decisions should always align with personal risk tolerance and financial objectives. Conclusion: A New Era for Investment Portfolios Cardone Capital’s latest acquisition of 100 BTC is more than just a transaction; it’s a powerful statement about the evolving nature of institutional investment. By strategically increasing its Cardone Capital Bitcoin holdings and pioneering a real estate-backed fund, the firm is showcasing a bold vision for the future of finance. This move not only reinforces Bitcoin’s standing as a legitimate institutional asset but also establishes an innovative model for funding digital asset accumulation through traditional means. As more firms follow this trailblazing path, the synergy between conventional finance and the burgeoning crypto economy will deepen, promising unprecedented opportunities and a truly diversified investment landscape. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What is Cardone Capital’s current Bitcoin holding? Following its recent acquisition of 100 BTC, Cardone Capital’s total Bitcoin holdings now stand at approximately 1,100 BTC. What is Cardone Capital’s Bitcoin acquisition strategy? Cardone Capital strategically acquires Bitcoin during price dips, aiming to capitalize on market corrections. Their stated goal is to reach 4,000 BTC by the end of the year. How does Cardone Capital plan to fund future Bitcoin purchases? The firm is preparing to launch a new fund backed by 10 real estate assets, specifically designed to support ongoing Bitcoin acquisitions and expand their digital asset portfolio. Why are traditional real estate firms like Cardone Capital investing in Bitcoin? Firms like Cardone Capital are investing in Bitcoin for portfolio diversification, as a hedge against inflation, and to capitalize on its long-term growth potential in the digital economy. It represents a strategic move to blend traditional and modern asset classes. What does ‘institutional Bitcoin adoption’ signify? Institutional Bitcoin adoption refers to the growing trend of large corporations, investment firms, and financial institutions adding Bitcoin to their balance sheets or integrating it into their financial products, signifying its increasing acceptance as a legitimate investment asset. Share this article with your network to spread the word about Cardone Capital’s bold move and the future of institutional crypto investments! Your insights are valuable! To learn more about the latest crypto market trends , explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin institutional adoption. title: XRP Blows Cold: Price Crash To $2.15 Still Possible If Buyers Falter
body: After rising to a new 7-year high off the back of strong buys, the XRP price has moved back downward in search of new support levels. This move has been spurred by the general bearish sentiment that has plagued the market as the Bitcoin price struggled to reclaim its all-time high levels, putting altcoins at risk once again. On its own, the XRP price is facing unique barriers, especially when it comes to buying, which could trigger another wave of decline. Directions The XRP Price Could Go Crypto analyst Thecafetrader has highlighted the possible directions that the XRP price could go in following its decline. These include both bullish and bearish directions, both being decided by buyers and how much weight they put behind their positions during this time. Related Reading: XRP Price To Climb 44% To $4.804 As Long As This Level Holds The first point that the analyst makes is the fact that the XRP price rally was driven by massive buyers. These buys had triggered a breakout above the 2024 highs, but met resistance from sellers once again. Thus, it suggests that bulls have been trapped at higher prices inside their positions. However, this is not the most concerning development. One thing that the analyst points out is the major decline in trading volume despite XRP hitting new highs this year. For example, back in 2024, when the XRP price had first crossed the $3 mark, the daily trading volume had peaked above $78 billion. But with the new highs above $3.6, the highest daily trading volume recorded was just above $41 billion. Given this, it suggests that there is a major decline in buying interest, especially as conviction has been impacted by the price decline. Interestingly, though, the buyers are not the only ones who seem to be abstaining from the XRP altcoin at this point. According to the analyst, there are no “real” sellers that are moving into the market. Therefore, there is still bullish momentum for a possible recovery back to $4.64. Related Reading: XRP, Dogecoin, And Shiba Inu Get Major Boost From Gemini Exchange Announcement Moving to the more bearish side, the analyst explains that the XRP price does need the strong buyers to step in to continue an uptrend. If these buyers fail to hold up, then the XRP price does risk crashing back downward from the initial $2.95 point of interest. The targets for such a decline are placed by the crypto analyst at $3.13 initially. However, the more the price struggles, the lower the targets go. Next is the $2.95 territory, then $2.15-$2.3, which the analyst calls a “good price” for entry. Then last but not least is the $1.60-$1.93 range, marked as a “steal.” Featured image from Dall.E, chart from TradingView.com

title: Asia stocks fall as Trump's new tariffs take effect and weak china data; U.S. futures slip ahead of key jobs report
body: Asia shares in red on Friday following U.S. President Trump’s executive order on Thursday imposing new tariff rates ranging from 10% to 41%, effective August 1, along with a 40% tariff on transshipped goods, further fueling market caution. Disappointing economic data from China, also weighed on sentiment after factory activity in the mainland unexpectedly contracted in July. U.S. President Donald Trump has imposed a 19% tariff on exports from Malaysia to the U.S., lower than the 25% rate he initially threatened in July. Gold prices were muted around $3,290 per ounce on Friday and were on track for its worst weekly performance since late June, pressured by a stronger US dollar following President Trump’s introduction of higher tariffs on multiple countries. Japan ( NKY:IND ) fell 0.67% to below 40,900 on Friday, giving back gains from the previous session as renewed trade tensions weighed on sentiment. The Japanese yen hovered around 150.7 per dollar on Friday, lingering at a four-month low, as the dollar held firm following President Donald Trump’s latest tariff actions. Japan's manufacturing sector contracted in July , with the S&P Global PMI falling to 48.9, a slight upward revision from the initial estimate but still below June's 50.1. Japan’s unemployment rate held steady at 2.5% in June 2025 for the fourth consecutive month, aligning with market estimates. China ( SHCOMP ) fell 0.56% struggled for clear direction on Friday after a surprise contraction in manufacturing activity dampened sentiment, and the offshore yuan weakened past 7.21 per dollar on Friday, hitting its lowest level in nearly two months and heading for a sharp weekly decline. The Caixin China General Manufacturing PMI dropped unexpectedly to 49.5 in July 2025, falling from 50.4 in June and missing forecasts of 50.2, marking the second time in three months that factory activity has contracted. Meanwhile, the US and China concluded a third round of trade talks this week. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent stated that the negotiations have “the makings of a trade deal,” with both nations facing an August 12 deadline to extend the current pause on tariffs. Hong Kong ( HSI ) fell 0.70% to 24,748 on the first trading day of August, falling for the fourth session while lingering at a two-week low. India ( SENSEX ) rose 0.01% to 81,080 in early trade on Friday, extending losses from the previous session. The HSBC India Manufacturing PMI was revised slightly lower to 59.1 in July 2025 from a preliminary estimate of 59.2, although it remained above June’s reading of 58.4. Australia ( AS51 ) fell 0.91% to around 8,660 on Friday, extending losses from the prior session, and heading for a second weekly decline, as US tariff uncertainty intensified after President Trump revised “reciprocal” duties on several countries, raising rates to 10–41%. The Australian dollar stabilized around $0.643 on Friday, halting a six-day losing streak as Australia avoided the latest US tariff hikes, with most imports remaining subject to the 10% rate. Australia's final demand Producer Price Index increased by 0.7% quarter-on-quarter in Q2 2025, missing market estimates of 0.9% which was also the growth figure in the previous quarter. Australia's manufacturing sector saw a modest expansion in July , with the S&P Global Manufacturing PMI easing slightly to 51.3 from 51.6 in June. Australia Trade Minister Don Farrell said on Friday the White House had confirmed that no country had reciprocal tariffs lower than Australia, suggesting that President Donald Trump had left the 10% baseline tariffs on Australian goods unchanged. In the U.S., on Thursday, all three major indexes ended in red as gains in Microsoft and Meta failed to lift the broader market amid renewed trade uncertainties and economic concerns. U.S. stock futures edged lower on Friday as investors awaited the closely watched July jobs report: Dow -0.15% ; S&P 500 -0.12% ; Nasdaq -0.17% . Currencies: ( JPY:USD ), ( CNY:USD ), ( AUD:USD ), ( INR:USD ), ( HKD:USD ), ( NZD:USD ). More on Asia: Australia's Q2 producer price index rises 0.7%, following soft consumer inflation report China's manufacturing sector contracts unexpectedly in July to 49.5 Japan's manufacturing sector shrinks in July to 48.9, unemployment holds steady Australia's factory growth eases to 51.3 in July, despite stronger production Gold rush in China: Households are piling into the safe-haven asset, Apollo says

title: Winklevoss Brothers Urged Trump to Drop CFTC Nominee Brian Quintenz: Report
body: Brian Quintenz was once seen as a strong contender to lead the CFTC. However, he now faces growing resistance from key crypto industry players. They argue he is too closely tied to the status quo. Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss, twin crypto billionaires and founders of Gemini, personally lobbied President Donald Trump over the weekend to reconsider his nominee to lead the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, Politico reported this week. As the Senate prepared to move forward with Quintenz’s nomination, the Winklevoss brothers reportedly stepped in. They urged Trump to withdraw his support. According to them, Quintenz, a former CFTC commissioner with industry ties, lacked the bold vision needed to align the agency with Trump’s crypto-focused agenda. The twins, known for their early investment in Bitcoin and longstanding support for Trump, showed concern that Quintenz would not push for the sweeping reforms they believe the CFTC needs. Winklevoss brothers pressed Trump to dump pick for top Wall Street regulator https://t.co/s7vMkiFfZJ — POLITICO (@politico) July 30, 2025 White House Halts Vote on Quintenz Amid Industry Pressure One key sticking point was his recent testimony backing a budget increase for the regulator to help oversee crypto markets, a move they seemed to view as bureaucratic, not transformational. At the White House’s request, the Senate Agriculture Committee abruptly canceled Monday’s vote on Quintenz’s nomination. However, despite the delay, a White House official later confirmed that Quintenz was still the administration’s choice. Behind the scenes, senior administration officials are reportedly working to keep Quintenz in place. The Winklevosses’ intervention is a sign of how assertively crypto executives are now engaging with Washington, particularly under Trump’s second term. Trump’s Vision for ‘Crypto Capital’ Puts CFTC in the Spotlight Since returning to office, Trump has doubled down on his ambition to make the US the “crypto capital of the world.” Just this week, the White House released a long-awaited policy report laying out recommendations to support the industry’s growth. The CFTC has long been tied to agricultural commodities and financial derivatives. Now, under Trump’s crypto strategy, it is set to play a larger role. His administration plans to expand the agency’s authority, giving it direct oversight of crypto assets such as Bitcoin and Ether. Quintenz, who served on the CFTC during Trump’s first term, currently leads policy efforts at Andreessen Horowitz’s crypto fund and holds a board seat at Kalshi , a prediction market platform. His experience has made him a key figure in crypto regulation, but also opened him up to scrutiny. Quintenz’s Kalshi Role Sparks Ethics Questions on Capitol Hill Crypto world and Tyler Winklevoss are in an uproar over ‘concerning’ Quintenz email reveal https://t.co/vG2EGi4bUu pic.twitter.com/GgEkll5UQ6 — New York Post (@nypost) July 31, 2025 On Thursday, the New York Post reported that emails from Quintenz surfaced on Capitol Hill this week. These reportedly show that during his nomination process, Quintenz’s associates sought information that could affect betting markets overseen by the CFTC. The report raised further questions about his role on Kalshi’s board. Although Quintenz has pledged not to benefit from privileged access, critics point to his financial interest in a company regulated by the very agency he is set to lead. It remains unclear whether the White House will continue to stand behind Quintenz or reopen the nomination. The post Winklevoss Brothers Urged Trump to Drop CFTC Nominee Brian Quintenz: Report appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Trump announced a 40% tariff on goods rerouted through other countries
body: Donald Trump just announced a fresh 40% tariff on any product the U.S. decides has been rerouted through another country, but gave absolutely no explanation on how that determination will actually work. The decision, announced by the White House on Thursday night, is aimed at stopping goods (mostly coming from China) from avoiding existing tariffs by getting repackaged or redirected through third-party countries. This new tariff was buried in a broader list of global duties ranging between 10% and 41%, and a senior U.S. official in Washington reportedly told reporters Thursday that the definition of transshipment would be decided “in the coming weeks,” even though the administration had earlier said it would be finalized before August 1. Southeast Asian countries stuck waiting for clarity This gap in clarity has left many Southeast Asian countries in a holding pattern. Places like Vietnam , Thailand, Cambodia, Indonesia, and Malaysia have become key exporters to the U.S. since Trump’s earlier trade war pushed firms to shift operations out of China. But most of those companies still rely on Chinese parts, raising questions about whether their exports will now be hit with the 40% penalty. Chantawit Tantasith, Thailand’s Deputy Minister of Commerce, said Friday that Thailand’s 19% tariff keeps the country competitive with others in the region, but added that the U.S. still hasn’t clarified what it will count as a local product. “We must await further clarification from the US regarding the negotiation process and rules of origin,” Chantawit said in a statement. Thailand’s Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira said separately that products made in Thailand need to include more than 40% local content to qualify as Thai-made, but confirmed that no agreement had yet been reached with Washington. The unspoken focus of this policy is China, even though the country wasn’t named directly in the statement. Trump has repeatedly blamed Chinese imports for hollowing out U.S. manufacturing and said transshipment is just another way for China to bypass tariffs. With the current tariff truce between the U.S. and China set to expire in two weeks, this new policy adds another obstacle to any ongoing talks. Trump holds firm as confusion grows Trump made his position clear on Wednesday, posting, “THE AUGUST FIRST DEADLINE IS THE AUGUST FIRST DEADLINE — IT STANDS STRONG, AND WILL NOT BE EXTENDED. A BIG DAY FOR AMERICA!!!” But despite that hard line, a White House official told CNBC-TV18 on Friday that the so-called ‘reciprocal’ tariffs would not kick in until August 7. In the updated directive, the U.S. also said that any country not listed in the latest tariff schedule would face a 10% additional duty. These changes modify the earlier executive order from April, which set up the structure for the new tariff strategy. Thursday’s update added the specific 40% rate for rerouted goods. Some trade experts are already warning this will have little effect unless enforcement is airtight. Leah Fahy, chief economist at Capital Economics, said in a note Friday, “It is still not clear how this will be implemented in practice.” She added that even if direct rerouting drops, trade diversion, the practice of sending products through friendly countries, will likely continue. “Even if outright rerouting is reduced, trade diversion will continue to dampen the impact of US tariffs on China’s aggregate export performance,” Leah wrote. Stephen Olson, a former U.S. trade negotiator now working at the ISEAS-Yusof Ishak Institute in Singapore, said the move is likely to make negotiations with China worse. “China will correctly perceive the transshipment provisions as directed against its interests,” Stephen said. “And it will inevitably spill over into its ongoing trade negotiations with the US.” Want your project in front of crypto’s top minds? Feature it in our next industry report, where data meets impact.

title: Analyst Warns XRP Holders as Bull Market Enters Final Stage
body: Crypto analyst StephisCrypto issued a cautionary update to XRP investors in a recent video post on Twitter. The tweet, captioned “#XRP WARNING!!!!!!”, featured an in-depth technical analysis suggesting that XRP is approaching the final phase of its bull market. StephisCrypto emphasized that the months ahead could bring the most substantial gains for XRP holders . However, he also underscored the need for vigilance and timely action as market conditions rapidly evolve. He began his commentary by comparing XRP’s current market structure to its behavior during the 2017 bull market. By analyzing monthly price charts, he noted strong similarities between the current setup and the earlier cycle, particularly in the pattern of an initial rally, a sideways correction period, and a final explosive move upward before a significant market-wide downturn. #XRP WARNING!!!!!! pic.twitter.com/tJdefflP8D — STEPH IS CRYPTO (@Steph_iscrypto) July 30, 2025 Technical Pattern Alignments with 2017 Cycle According to the analyst, XRP experienced a sharp rally earlier in 2024, followed by a six-month correction phase. He pointed out that this mirrors the price structure observed in 2017, where XRP also underwent a three-month rally, a subsequent six-month consolidation, and a final two-month upward surge that marked the top of that cycle. StephisCrypto believes that XRP is now entering that final surge phase once again in 2025. He stated that the remainder of 2025 is likely to be critical for those holding XRP , highlighting this as the period in which the largest gains of the current cycle could be realized. He also examined the altcoin season index, which is currently at a reading of 41. tephisCrypto explained that a value above 75 has historically indicated a peak in altcoin momentum, often followed by a sharp correction. As such, he advised investors to monitor this index. Impact of FOMC Meetings and Support Zone Stability The analyst also reviewed XRP’s behavior following recent FOMC meetings. He showed that after the January 2025 meeting, XRP dropped by approximately 43% in one week. Similarly, the March 19 meeting resulted in a 37% decline in two to three weeks. A later FOMC meeting led to a 27% increase, while the most recent event coincided with a 12% decline. StephisCrypto cautioned that these meetings have consistently introduced high volatility into the market and are worth watching for future developments. Currently, XRP is trading above a critical resistance level that had previously acted as a major barrier throughout late 2024 and early 2025. StephisCrypto noted that XRP had faced several rejections at this level, including a false breakout in January. However, multiple weekly candles are now holding above this zone, leading him to maintain a bullish outlook as long as the price remains above $3. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Potential for a Parabolic Breakout One of the key technical signals highlighted in the analysis was the presence of an upward sloping trend line that has been in place since 2021. StephisCrypto reminded viewers that Bitcoin had a similar trend line, which it recently broke, leading to significant price appreciation. He believes XRP may follow the same path if it manages to break above this long-standing resistance trend line. He concluded his video by discussing the two-month time frame and the current state of the stochastic RSI, which he indicated is now overbought. He drew a parallel to the 2017 cycle, where the stochastic RSI peaked before the final move higher. In that cycle, despite a downward-trending RSI, XRP experienced a last sharp upward rally before the bear market began. StephisCrypto stated that this condition is repeating, suggesting a final push upward may now be imminent. StephisCrypto presented a structured and historically grounded argument that XRP is entering a critical phase in its market cycle. While identifying opportunities for considerable gains, he urged holders to remain cautious, monitor technical indicators closely, and be prepared for potential volatility, especially in light of macroeconomic events such as future FOMC meetings. title: Bithumb ZRC Suspension: Crucial Alert for Token Holders
body: BitcoinWorld Bithumb ZRC Suspension: Crucial Alert for Token Holders In the fast-paced world of cryptocurrency, staying informed about critical updates is not just recommended, it’s essential. One such vital announcement comes from South Korean crypto giant Bithumb, signaling a temporary halt in services for the ZRC token. This isn’t just a minor blip; it’s a proactive measure designed to safeguard your assets and ensure the smooth evolution of the underlying blockchain technology. Understanding the implications of this Bithumb ZRC suspension is paramount for every token holder. What Does the Bithumb ZRC Suspension Entail? Bithumb, a prominent player in the global cryptocurrency exchange landscape, has officially communicated a temporary suspension of deposits and withdrawals for the ZRC token. This pivotal announcement was made on its official website, providing clarity and foresight to its user base. The suspension is scheduled to commence precisely at 08:00 UTC on August 5th. This isn’t an arbitrary decision; it’s a strategic move executed in direct support of an impending and significant network upgrade for Zircuit, the blockchain underpinning the ZRC token. For users, this means that during the specified period, any attempts to deposit ZRC tokens into their Bithumb wallets or withdraw them to external addresses will be temporarily unavailable. The exchange is taking this step to prevent any potential loss of funds, transaction errors, or discrepancies that could arise during the upgrade process. It’s a standard industry practice, yet one that always warrants close attention from the community. Why Are Network Upgrades Crucial, and What is Zircuit? To fully grasp the significance of the Bithumb ZRC suspension , it’s important to understand the ‘why’ behind network upgrades and the role of Zircuit. Blockchain networks, much like traditional software, require periodic updates to improve performance, enhance security, introduce new features, or fix vulnerabilities. These upgrades are vital for the long-term health, scalability, and innovation of the decentralized ecosystem. Zircuit’s Vision: Zircuit is an innovative Layer 2 (L2) rollup network built on Ethereum, designed to offer enhanced security and efficiency. It aims to provide a highly secure and scalable environment for decentralized applications (dApps) by leveraging advanced zero-knowledge proofs and AI-driven security features. Its focus on robust security for Web3 is a key differentiator in the competitive L2 landscape. The Role of ZRC Token: While specific details about the ZRC token’s utility within the Zircuit ecosystem would be detailed by the project itself, typically, such tokens serve various functions, including governance, staking, transaction fees, or access to network features. The Upgrade’s Importance: A network upgrade for Zircuit signifies a significant leap forward, potentially bringing improved transaction speeds, lower fees, enhanced security protocols, or new functionalities that will benefit both developers and end-users within its ecosystem. What Does the Bithumb ZRC Suspension Mean for You? The immediate impact of the Bithumb ZRC suspension is straightforward: you won’t be able to move your ZRC tokens in or out of the exchange during the specified timeframe. However, the broader implications require a bit more consideration: No Deposits or Withdrawals: From 08:00 UTC on August 5th, any deposit or withdrawal requests for ZRC on Bithumb will be rejected or held until services resume. Trading May Continue (Check Bithumb’s Policy): While deposits and withdrawals are suspended, trading of ZRC pairs on Bithumb might continue. Users should verify Bithumb’s official announcement for clarification on trading activities during the suspension period. Often, exchanges allow trading to continue, but without the ability to move assets off or onto the platform. Asset Security: Your ZRC tokens held within your Bithumb account remain secure. The suspension is a protective measure, not an indication of any security breach or issue with the exchange itself. Impact on Arbitrage/Trading Strategies: Traders who rely on quick transfers between exchanges for arbitrage or specific trading strategies involving ZRC will need to adjust their plans accordingly. How Can You Prepare for the Zircuit Network Upgrade and Bithumb ZRC Suspension ? Preparation is key to navigating such temporary service interruptions smoothly. Here are actionable insights for ZRC token holders: Plan Ahead: If you need to deposit or withdraw ZRC tokens from Bithumb for any reason (e.g., moving to a personal wallet, transferring to another exchange, or participating in a DeFi protocol), ensure you complete these transactions well before the 08:00 UTC August 5th deadline. Monitor Official Announcements: Regularly check Bithumb’s official website, social media channels, and notification alerts. They will provide updates on the progress of the Zircuit network upgrade and, most importantly, the exact time when ZRC deposit and withdrawal services will resume. Avoid Last-Minute Transactions: As the deadline approaches, network congestion can increase, potentially leading to delays. It’s always best to complete any critical transactions with ample time to spare. Understand the Zircuit Upgrade: While not directly related to the suspension, familiarizing yourself with the details of the Zircuit network upgrade can help you understand potential new features or changes that might affect your ZRC holdings post-upgrade. Look for announcements from the Zircuit project team. Diversify Holdings (General Advice): While not specific to this event, maintaining a diversified portfolio and not keeping all your assets on a single exchange is a good practice for overall risk management. The Broader Significance: Network Health and User Trust These types of suspensions, while temporarily inconvenient, underscore the dynamic and evolving nature of blockchain technology. They are a testament to the continuous efforts by blockchain developers to improve their networks and by exchanges to provide a secure and reliable trading environment. For Bithumb, facilitating this Bithumb ZRC suspension demonstrates its commitment to supporting the technological advancements of the projects it lists, thereby fostering trust within its user community. A well-executed network upgrade can lead to a more robust, scalable, and secure blockchain, ultimately benefiting all participants in the ecosystem, including ZRC token holders. Exchanges play a critical role as intermediaries, ensuring that these transitions happen as smoothly as possible, minimizing risks for their users. Looking Beyond the Suspension: What Comes Next? Once the Zircuit network upgrade is successfully completed and thoroughly tested, Bithumb will announce the resumption of ZRC deposit and withdrawal services. Users should anticipate a brief period of post-upgrade monitoring by the exchange to ensure stability before full services are restored. It’s crucial not to attempt transactions until Bithumb officially confirms the resumption. Following the upgrade, ZRC token holders might experience improved network performance or new functionalities that could impact their interaction with the token. Staying abreast of both Bithumb’s announcements and Zircuit’s project updates will be key to understanding the full scope of these changes. The Bithumb ZRC suspension for deposits and withdrawals is a standard, albeit important, procedure in the cryptocurrency world. It highlights the ongoing evolution of blockchain technology and the proactive measures exchanges take to ensure asset security during critical network upgrades. By understanding the reasons behind such suspensions and taking proactive steps, ZRC token holders can navigate this period with confidence and minimal disruption. Always prioritize official announcements from Bithumb and Zircuit to stay informed and make well-timed decisions regarding your digital assets. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: Why is Bithumb suspending ZRC deposits and withdrawals? A1: Bithumb is temporarily suspending ZRC deposits and withdrawals to support the upcoming network upgrade of Zircuit, the underlying blockchain for the ZRC token. This is a standard procedure to ensure asset safety and prevent transaction issues during the upgrade. Q2: When exactly will the Bithumb ZRC suspension begin? A2: The suspension of ZRC token deposits and withdrawals on Bithumb will begin at 08:00 UTC on August 5th. Q3: Can I still trade ZRC on Bithumb during the suspension period? A3: While deposits and withdrawals are suspended, trading of ZRC pairs might still be active on Bithumb. Users should refer to Bithumb’s official announcement for precise details regarding trading activities during the suspension. Q4: What should I do if I need to move my ZRC tokens before the suspension? A4: If you need to deposit or withdraw ZRC tokens, you must complete these transactions well before the 08:00 UTC August 5th deadline. It’s advisable to do so with ample time to account for potential network congestion. Q5: When will ZRC deposits and withdrawals resume on Bithumb? A5: Bithumb will announce the resumption of ZRC deposit and withdrawal services once the Zircuit network upgrade is successfully completed and thoroughly tested. Users should monitor Bithumb’s official channels for these updates. Q6: Are my ZRC tokens safe on Bithumb during the suspension? A6: Yes, your ZRC tokens held within your Bithumb account remain secure. The suspension is a protective measure implemented by the exchange to safeguard assets during the network upgrade, not an indication of any security breach. title: Coinbase Sees Q2 Retail Trading Decline, But XRP Outperforms Ethereum in Consumer Revenue
body: Coinbase reported a sharp drop in retail trading volumes for Q2, with total transaction revenue falling 39% quarter-over-quarter to $764 million. Key Takeaways: XRP outperformed Ethereum in Coinbase’s Q2 consumer revenue, holding a 13% share. Retail interest in XRP surged after legal clarity, with Q1 trading share peaking at 18%. XRP notional open interest hit a record $8.8B, signaling growing bullish sentiment. However, XRP emerged as a standout, generating more consumer transaction revenue than Ethereum for the second consecutive quarter. According to the company’s Q2 shareholder letter , XRP accounted for 13% of Coinbase’s consumer transaction revenue, edging out Ethereum at 12%. XRP Retail Trading Surged to 18% in Q1 After Legal Clarity This builds on Q1 figures, where XRP’s share jumped from 10% to a temporary peak of 18%, fueled by renewed retail interest following legal clarity around the asset. Ethereum, despite delivering a stronger overall return in Q2 — 38% compared to XRP’s 11% — trailed in consumer revenue. Analysts point to a growing disconnect between retail trading activity and broader institutional flows. Ethereum’s momentum was largely attributed to developments around its ecosystem and growing anticipation for spot ETF approvals. XRP’s steady rise in trading share from below 10% earlier in 2024 underscores the impact of regulatory clarity on retail behavior. XRP holders are the most valuable in the whole of crypto. $XRP accounted for a higher percentage of Coinbase trading revenue than $ETH or $SOL . (Source: Coinbase Q2 2025 earnings) pic.twitter.com/6VQc1FwWgi — Dom | EasyA (@dom_kwok) August 1, 2025 XRP saw a spike in notional open interest for its perpetual futures contracts last month. Notional open interest, the total value of leveraged positions held by traders, climbed to an all-time high of $8.8 billion , according to CoinGlass. The figure corresponds to nearly 2.9 billion XRP in open contracts. The previous record for XRP notional open interest stood at $8.3 billion, which was hit in late January before the start of former U.S. President Donald Trump’s second term. Across most venues, XRP’s funding rate was positive and climbing, signaling a market where longs are willing to pay shorts to maintain positions, a classic indicator of bullish sentiment. As reported, the number of wallets holding at least 1 million XRP tokens has also surged to an all-time high . Coinbase Named TIME ‘Disruptor’ As reported, TIME has recognized Coinbase as one of 2025’s 100 Most Influential Companies , labeling the crypto exchange a “disruptor” for its significant role in shaping US digital asset policies and markets. The accolade highlights Coinbase’s aggressive advocacy in Washington and its expanding influence in the crypto sector. Coinbase’s stock has surged 42% year-to-date, climbing from around $303 to a high near $382. The rise comes amid the passage of the GENIUS stablecoin bill and Coinbase’s historic inclusion in the S&P 500 in May . TIME noted the exchange as a key driver behind the industry’s policy efforts and predicted Coinbase could become the central hub for crypto trading in the US. Beyond the US, Coinbase is broadening its reach in Europe, securing a license under the EU’s MiCA regulatory framework through Luxembourg’s financial regulator. Additionally, Coinbase is seeking SEC approval to offer tokenized equities, which would position it as a competitor to popular retail trading platforms like Robinhood and WeBull. The post Coinbase Sees Q2 Retail Trading Decline, But XRP Outperforms Ethereum in Consumer Revenue appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Urgent Concerns: Trump Stablecoin Ties Spark Unprecedented Conflict of Interest Debate
body: BitcoinWorld Urgent Concerns: Trump Stablecoin Ties Spark Unprecedented Conflict of Interest Debate In the fast-paced world of cryptocurrency, where innovation often collides with regulation, a significant storm is brewing on Capitol Hill. The spotlight is now firmly on the potential conflicts of interest surrounding the Trump family’s ventures into the digital asset space, specifically concerning a particular Trump stablecoin . This isn’t just about financial transactions; it’s about the very integrity of financial policy and the trust placed in public officials. US Democratic senators Elizabeth Warren, Chris Van Hollen, and Ron Wyden have raised alarm bells, directly appealing to Comptroller of the Currency Jonathan Gould at the OCC to address what they describe as an “unprecedented conflict of interest.” Their concerns are rooted in the Trump family’s financial stake in the stablecoin USD1, fearing it could allow President Trump to unduly influence federal crypto policy for personal gain. This situation highlights a critical juncture for cryptocurrency regulation and ethical governance. What Are the Core Concerns About Trump Stablecoin Ties? The core of the senators’ apprehension stems from the potential for a sitting or former President to leverage their position for personal financial benefit through digital assets. The letter sent to the OCC outlines several key concerns: Direct Financial Interest: The Trump family’s reported financial stake in the stablecoin USD1 is at the heart of the matter. This direct tie raises questions about whether future policy decisions regarding stablecoins or the broader crypto market could be swayed to benefit personal investments. “Unprecedented Conflict of Interest”: The lawmakers explicitly labeled the situation as unparalleled, emphasizing that such a direct financial link between a presidential family and a specific financial product could undermine public trust in regulatory processes. Threat to Financial Stability: Beyond ethics, the senators warned that this scenario poses a threat to the nation’s financial stability. If stablecoin policy is perceived as influenced by personal gain rather than sound economic principles, it could lead to market instability or erode confidence in the US financial system. Call for OCC Action: The letter urges the OCC to provide a clear explanation of how it plans to address these potential conflicts. The agency’s role in overseeing financial institutions and ensuring market integrity makes its response crucial. The situation surrounding the Trump stablecoin needs transparent handling. The implications of these concerns extend beyond just the Trump family. They touch upon the broader challenge of regulating a rapidly evolving financial landscape where traditional ethics frameworks may not fully apply to digital assets and the potential for new forms of influence. Why Do Stablecoins Matter in This Debate? Stablecoins are a unique class of cryptocurrencies designed to minimize price volatility by pegging their value to a stable asset, such as the US dollar. They serve as a crucial bridge between traditional finance and the volatile crypto market, facilitating trading, lending, and payments. The specific stablecoin mentioned, USD1, reportedly has ties to the Trump family, making its regulatory status and future particularly sensitive. Here’s why stablecoins are central to this discussion: Bridge to Traditional Finance: Stablecoins are often seen as the gateway for mainstream adoption of cryptocurrencies. Their stability makes them attractive for everyday transactions and institutional use, increasing their systemic importance. Regulatory Scrutiny: Due to their potential to grow into significant payment systems, stablecoins have been under intense scrutiny from regulators worldwide. Discussions around reserve requirements, consumer protection, and financial stability are ongoing. Potential for Influence: If a prominent political family has a vested interest in a specific stablecoin, it raises legitimate questions about whether their influence could be used to shape favorable regulatory outcomes, potentially disadvantaging competitors or the broader market. This is a key aspect of the Trump stablecoin debate. The integrity of stablecoin regulation is paramount for the health of the crypto ecosystem and the broader financial system. Any perception of undue influence could severely damage confidence. Navigating the Challenges: Potential Conflicts and Financial Stability The challenges presented by the alleged Trump stablecoin ties are multi-faceted, encompassing ethical, regulatory, and systemic risks. Understanding these complexities is vital for both policymakers and the public. Aspect Typical Stablecoin Regulation Goal Concerns with Trump Stablecoin Ties Primary Goal Ensuring consumer protection, fostering financial stability, maintaining market integrity. Risk of policy decisions being influenced by personal financial gain, not public interest. Oversight Bodies’ Role Independent assessment and enforcement by OCC, Federal Reserve, SEC, Treasury. OCC is specifically pressed to address potential conflicts, raising questions about independence. Key Risk Factors De-pegging events, liquidity crises, use in illicit finance, lack of transparency. “Unprecedented conflict of interest” creating systemic risk and eroding public trust. The fear is that if a president or their family has a significant financial interest in a specific stablecoin, they might be incentivized to push for regulations that benefit that particular asset, potentially at the expense of fair competition or broader market health. This could lead to a lack of confidence in the regulatory environment, deterring legitimate innovation and investment in the US crypto space. Moreover, it could set a dangerous precedent for future administrations. Actionable Insights: What’s Next for Stablecoin Regulation? The letter from Senators Warren, Van Hollen, and Wyden is not merely a complaint; it’s a call to action that could shape the future of stablecoin regulation and ethical oversight in the digital age. Here are some potential next steps and implications: Increased Scrutiny on Political Ties: Expect greater focus on the financial holdings of political figures and their families, especially concerning emerging asset classes like cryptocurrencies. This could lead to more stringent disclosure requirements. OCC’s Response: The Comptroller of the Currency, Jonathan Gould, is now under pressure to provide a robust and transparent response. His actions will be closely watched by lawmakers, industry participants, and the public. A failure to adequately address these concerns could lead to further legislative action. Broader Regulatory Framework: This incident could accelerate discussions around a comprehensive federal framework for stablecoins, ensuring they are regulated similarly to traditional financial instruments, with strong provisions against conflicts of interest. The goal is to prevent any future Trump stablecoin type situations from undermining trust. Public Awareness: The debate brings crucial attention to the intersection of politics, finance, and technology. It educates the public about the importance of ethical governance in the digital asset space and the potential for new forms of influence. Ultimately, this situation underscores the need for clear, consistent, and ethically sound regulatory principles that can adapt to the rapid evolution of financial technology while upholding public trust. In Summary: The concerns raised by Democratic senators regarding the Trump family’s stablecoin ties represent a critical moment for US cryptocurrency policy. What began as a venture into digital assets has escalated into a serious debate about potential conflicts of interest, financial stability, and the integrity of regulatory oversight. The focus on the USD1 stablecoin and the call for the OCC to address these issues highlight the growing importance of ethical governance in the rapidly expanding crypto market. As the industry matures, ensuring transparency and preventing undue influence will be paramount to fostering trust and enabling responsible innovation. This ongoing saga serves as a powerful reminder that as digital assets become more integrated into the global financial system, so too must the frameworks that govern them evolve to uphold the highest standards of accountability and public interest. The resolution of this Trump stablecoin controversy will undoubtedly set precedents for future political involvement in the crypto sphere. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What is a stablecoin, and why are they relevant to this issue? Stablecoins are cryptocurrencies pegged to a stable asset like the US dollar, reducing volatility. They are relevant because the Trump family’s alleged financial stake in the USD1 stablecoin raises concerns about potential policy influence. Which senators raised concerns about the Trump family’s stablecoin ties? US Democratic Senators Elizabeth Warren, Chris Van Hollen, and Ron Wyden sent a letter to the OCC expressing their concerns. What specific stablecoin is mentioned in the controversy? The stablecoin at the center of the controversy is USD1, which reportedly has financial ties to the Trump family. What is the OCC’s role in addressing these concerns? The Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) is being pressed by the senators to explain how it will address the potential conflicts of interest and ensure the integrity of federal crypto policy. Why is this situation considered an “unprecedented conflict of interest”? Lawmakers describe it as “unprecedented” due to the direct financial stake of a presidential family in a specific financial product, raising fears of personal gain influencing federal policy and threatening financial stability. Did this article shed light on the complexities of political influence in the crypto world? Share your thoughts and help spread awareness by sharing this article on your social media platforms! Let’s keep the conversation going about responsible crypto regulation and governance. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping stablecoin regulation and institutional adoption. title: Bitcoin Breaks Record! Highest Monthly Close in 16-Year History! Here's All the Data
body: Bitcoin closed July at $115,768, marking its first monthly close at this level in its 16-year history. Although the world's largest cryptocurrency fell 2.34% in the last 24 hours, the close was a record. Bitcoin Hits All-Time Monthly Close at $115,768 “Bitcoin closing this month at an all-time high isn’t just a headline; it’s a testament to the market’s resilience and maturation,” said Rachael Lucas, crypto analyst at BTC Markets. Lucas noted that despite the large 80,000 BTC transfer to Galaxy Digital in July and the subsequent sell-off, the price remained stable. While this sell-off caused a brief 4% drop in Bitcoin, the market quickly absorbed the impact. “This level of recovery shows that a strong buyer base has formed in the market that trusts Bitcoin,” Lucas said, emphasizing that Bitcoin remains resilient despite macroeconomic uncertainties during this period of increasing institutional interest. On the other hand, LVRG Research Director Nick Ruck stated that investors can realize profits, and this will depend on the policies of the US Federal Reserve (Fed), Trump's possible tariffs and ETF fund flows. Spot Bitcoin ETFs have experienced outflows in recent days, with the strong inflows of the first half of July seemingly giving way to weaker net flows. However, Ruck stated that the current decline is temporary and that he expects a recovery in August. Lucas emphasized that Bitcoin is in a strong position in the long term: “Bitcoin is increasingly adopted as a scarce, decentralized asset, and its role in the global financial system is strengthening.” *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Bitcoin Breaks Record! Highest Monthly Close in 16-Year History! Here's All the Data
