title: Financial Firm Mill City Ventures III Purchased a Large Portion of This Altcoin! Here Are the Details
body: Mill City Ventures III, a provider of short-term lending and financial solutions, has officially established its corporate Sui treasury after closing a $450 million private funding round. Mill City Purchases 76.3 Million SUI Tokens After $450 Million in Private Funding The company purchased a total of 76,271,187 SUI tokens through over-the-counter (OTC) agreements with the Sui Foundation. The purchase price was announced as $3.6389 on average. “Mill City will continue its SUI accumulation strategy with new purchases from the open market. Thanks to its collaboration with the Sui Foundation, Mill City is currently the only crypto treasury strategy with official foundation support,” the company said in a statement. Mill City plans to use approximately 98% of the net proceeds from the private funding round for SUI token acquisition and treasury management. Notable investors including Big Brain Holdings, Galaxy Digital, Pantera Capital, M2, Electric Capital, and GSR also participated in the funding round. “Mill City differentiates itself by offering public market investors institutional-scale, liquid access to the digital asset ecosystem. Building its treasury on SUI creates a strong foundation for long-term exposure to this next-generation blockchain platform,” said Galaxy CEO Mike Novogratz. Sui is a Layer 1 blockchain network developed by Mysten Labs and powered by the Move programming language designed by Meta's former blockchain team. At the time of writing, the SUI token was trading at $3.54, down 3.8%. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Financial Firm Mill City Ventures III Purchased a Large Portion of This Altcoin! Here Are the Details

title: Crypto Hack Losses Jump 27% in July to $142M, Led by CoinDCX and GMX
body: Crypto hack losses jumped 27.2% to $142 million in July 2025, up from $111.6 million in June, as seventeen major security breaches targeted exchanges and DeFi protocols, according to PeckShield data. Indian exchange CoinDCX suffered the month’s largest attack at $44.2 million through insider involvement, while GMX lost $42 million in a re-entrancy exploit before recovering funds through a white-hat agreement. Source: PeckShield CoinDCX Breach Exposes Insider Threat Through Employee Compromise The CoinDCX attack on July 19 resulted from compromised login credentials belonging to software engineer Rahul Agarwal, who was arrested on suspicion of involvement in the $44 million theft. Police investigations revealed that Agarwal used his company laptop for freelance work, receiving a WhatsApp call from Germany about a file completion that likely contained malicious code. The breach occurred at 2:37 AM when an unknown person accessed the system and transferred 1 USDT to test the connection. A CoinDCX employee was found using the company laptop for freelance jobs, which led hackers to exploit login credentials to siphon $44 million in crypto. #CoinDCX #CryptoHack #IndianCryptoExchange https://t.co/0EivOLdqEJ — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) July 31, 2025 At 9:40 AM, hackers siphoned $44 million and distributed funds across six wallets, according to police statements from Neblio Technologies vice-president Hardeep Singh. Cybersecurity experts from Cyvers linked the exploit to North Korea’s Lazarus Group, noting similarities to the $234 million WazirX hack in 2024. The attack pattern involved systematic fund extraction and immediate distribution to multiple addresses to complicate recovery efforts. Agarwal admitted during interrogation that he received approximately $17,131 in his bank account from unknown sources over the past year, claiming the payments came from part-time work. The incident coincided with acquisition rumors involving Coinbase , which CoinDCX CEO Sumit Gupta later denied. GMX Recovers $40.5M After Re-Entrancy Vulnerability Exploitation GMX suffered a $42 million exploit on July 9 through a re-entrancy vulnerability in its V1 contracts that bypassed the nonReentrant modifier. The attacker manipulated BTC average short prices through the Vault contract, artificially inflating GLP token values before redeeming them for profit using flash loans. The exploiter agreed to a white-hat deal , returning approximately $40.5 million, including 10,000 ETH and 10.5 million FRAX tokens, while keeping a $5 million bounty. However, the remaining $32 million was converted to 11,700 ETH, generating an additional $3 million profit due to Ethereum price appreciation. GMX paused trading on Avalanche and disabled GLP minting on Arbitrum pending user reimbursement procedures. The GMX exploiter agrees to return $42M in stolen assets for a $5M white-hat bounty, per @lookonchain #GMX #DeFi https://t.co/RXjQ9IiH7k — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) July 11, 2025 The protocol confirmed that V1 positions would be wound down and migrated to a reimbursement pool, while warning all V1 forks to implement immediate security fixes. Other significant July breaches included BigONE exchange losing $28 million through supply chain compromise, WOO X suffering $12 million in losses from a targeted phishing attack, and Future Protocol losing $4.2 million. BigONE’s production network was compromised when attackers modified server logic for account operations and risk controls. The July surge continues 2025’s devastating security trend, with crypto investors losing over $2.2 billion in the first half through 344 incidents . Wallet-related breaches accounted for $1.7 billion across 34 attacks, while phishing attacks stole $410 million in 132 separate incidents. Crypto investors have lost $2.2B to hacks and scams in H1 2025, with $187M recovered as threats shift, reports @CertiK . #CryptoSecurity #Cryptohacks https://t.co/5KCaVsYnbg — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) June 30, 2025 Physical violence against crypto holders escalated alongside digital attacks, with 32 “wrench attacks” reported globally in 2025, putting the year on pace to exceed 2021’s record of 36 violent incidents. Nearly one-third occurred in France, where attackers increasingly target family members of cryptocurrency holders. The average loss per incident reached $7.1 million with a median of $90,000, while recovery efforts returned $187 million through law enforcement, white-hat arrangements, and exchange cooperation. Despite partial recoveries, net losses for 2025’s first half totaled approximately $2.29 billion, already exceeding all of 2024’s crypto security losses. The post Crypto Hack Losses Jump 27% in July to $142M, Led by CoinDCX and GMX appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: Senator Warren Presses US Banking Regulator Over Trump Family’s Crypto Business Links
body: US Senator Elizabeth Warren, alongside Senators Chris Van Hollen and Ron Wyden, has urged the nation’s top banking regulator to investigate potential conflicts of interest involving the Trump family’s cryptocurrency ventures. Key Takeaways: Senators are pressing the OCC over Trump’s potential financial conflicts tied to the stablecoin USD1. USD1, launched by a Trump-linked platform, is central to a $2B deal involving MGX and Binance. Lawmakers warn the stablecoin poses an “unprecedented conflict of interest” tied to the presidency. In a letter sent Thursday to Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) head Jonathan Gould, the senators raised concerns about President Donald Trump’s “continued use of cryptocurrency business ventures to line their pockets.” The letter specifically questions how the OCC, now the primary regulator of stablecoins under the recently passed GENIUS Act, will safeguard the financial system against undue influence from Trump’s personal business interests. “The bill does nothing to prevent President Trump, his family, or his affiliates from financially benefiting from the issuance and sale of stablecoins,” the senators wrote. Trump-Linked Stablecoin USD1 at Center of Senate Inquiry, Warren Says The focus of the inquiry is USD1, a stablecoin launched in March 2024 by World Liberty Financial, a decentralized finance platform linked to the Trump family. The senators argue Trump’s financial interests are “intricately tied” to the stablecoin’s success, creating what they describe as “an unprecedented conflict of interest.” “The launch of a stablecoin directly tied to a sitting President who stands to benefit financially from the stablecoin’s success presents significant threats to our financial system,” the letter said. The controversy deepened with revelations of a $2 billion deal involving Emirati firm MGX and Binance, using USD1 to facilitate the investment. The senators called it “a staggering model for corruption,” highlighting that Binance, which pleaded guilty to U.S. anti-money laundering violations, also helped develop USD1’s code. The letter ends with a demand for transparency, asking if Gould believes he serves at the President’s pleasure and whether he would step down if pressured. Reminder: Trump is pushing for crypto legislation to keep lining his own pocket. President Bush's former ethics lawyer says we have never had a president since the Civil War with such a conflict of interest. We should not pass any crypto legislation without shutting this down. pic.twitter.com/GIIv9UapZc — Elizabeth Warren (@SenWarren) July 10, 2025 It also urges the OCC to consider an investigation into World Liberty’s competitors, with responses requested by August 14. USD1 currently ranks as the world’s seventh-largest stablecoin, with a market cap of $2.17 billion, ahead of offerings from PayPal and Ripple, according to CoinGecko. Trump’s Crypto Holdings Make Up Key Portion of His Fortune Trump’s crypto-linked holdings are also a substantial part of his personal wealth . Bloomberg’s Billionaires Index estimates that TMTG stock represents $2.2 billion of Trump’s $6.6 billion fortune. His broader cryptocurrency investments are believed to have gained at least $620 million in recent months. However, the move is raising concerns among some industry figures. Nick Carter, general partner at Castle Island Ventures and a Trump supporter, said the overlap between Trump’s political influence and his financial exposure to crypto markets could create a conflict of interest. “It’s always a headache to have businesses with conflicting interests,” he told Bloomberg. As reported, nearly 70 nominees and officials in the Trump administration reportedly hold crypto or investments in blockchain companies , with holdings ranging from modest sums to over $120 million. The group includes Vice President JD Vance and seven Cabinet members or nominees, who collectively disclosed at least $2 million in crypto assets. The post Senator Warren Presses US Banking Regulator Over Trump Family’s Crypto Business Links appeared first on Cryptonews .

title: USDT Circulation: Resurgent Stablecoin Activity Signals Market Revival
body: BitcoinWorld USDT Circulation: Resurgent Stablecoin Activity Signals Market Revival The crypto world is often characterized by its dynamic shifts and constant evolution. After a period of significant market volatility in early 2022, a key indicator is now painting a picture of renewed optimism and stability: the remarkable recovery in USDT circulation . This resurgence, highlighted by on-chain market intelligence platform Glassnode, suggests a strengthening foundation for market activity and liquidity. What Does the Resurgent USDT Circulation Signify? According to recent insights from Glassnode, the 30-day moving average of USDT transfer volume has recently tapped an impressive $52.9 billion. This figure is more than just a statistic; it serves as a powerful barometer for the health and vibrancy of the stablecoin market. The transfer volume represents the total value of USDT moved across various blockchain networks within a specific period, indicating how actively the stablecoin is being used for transactions, trading, and other financial operations. A higher transfer volume and increased USDT circulation generally point to several positive trends within the cryptocurrency ecosystem: Enhanced Liquidity: More USDT moving means greater ease for traders to enter and exit positions, reducing slippage and improving overall market efficiency. Increased Trading Activity: Stablecoins like USDT are fundamental for trading pairs on exchanges. A rise in their circulation often correlates with heightened trading volumes across various cryptocurrencies. Restored Market Confidence: After periods of uncertainty, a recovery in stablecoin activity suggests that market participants are regaining trust and are more willing to hold and transact with these pegged assets. Growth in Decentralized Finance (DeFi): USDT is a cornerstone of many DeFi protocols. Increased circulation can signal a renewed interest and participation in lending, borrowing, and other DeFi applications. This recovery indicates that the circulation speed and overall market activity of stablecoins are steadily returning to more robust levels, reflecting a healthier market environment. How Are Different Blockchains Contributing to USDT Circulation? The distribution of this substantial USDT circulation across various blockchain networks offers crucial insights into the evolving landscape of stablecoin adoption. From January to May of the current year, two major players have clearly dominated the scene, showcasing their unique strengths in facilitating USDT transfers: Blockchain Network USDT Transfer Volume Share (Jan-May) Key Advantages for USDT Transactions Tron Over 55% Low transaction fees, high transaction throughput, fast confirmation times, making it ideal for frequent transfers. Ethereum Over 27% Robust and established decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem, broad exchange support, strong security, and wide developer community. Tron’s leading position is largely attributed to its design, which prioritizes speed and affordability, making it highly attractive for everyday transactions and arbitrage opportunities. Ethereum, despite its often higher gas fees, maintains a significant share due to its foundational role in the DeFi space and its extensive network of dApps and integrations. The continued dominance of these two networks underscores their importance in facilitating global USDT circulation and highlights the diverse needs of stablecoin users. Benefits of Robust USDT Circulation for the Crypto Ecosystem The health of USDT circulation directly impacts the broader cryptocurrency market in several beneficial ways: Market Stability: As a stablecoin pegged to the US dollar, USDT provides a safe haven during market volatility. Its active circulation helps in price discovery and reduces extreme fluctuations. Enhanced Trading Opportunities: With abundant USDT available, traders can quickly move in and out of positions, facilitating faster execution of strategies and improving market efficiency. This leads to tighter spreads and better pricing on exchanges. Arbitrage Efficiency: The ability to quickly transfer large volumes of USDT across different exchanges and networks allows for efficient arbitrage, helping to equalize prices across various platforms. Gateway for New Entrants: For many new users, stablecoins like USDT serve as the initial entry point into the crypto market, providing a familiar dollar-pegged asset before venturing into more volatile cryptocurrencies. Fueling DeFi Growth: USDT is a primary asset used in decentralized lending, borrowing, and liquidity provision protocols. Robust circulation ensures these protocols have sufficient capital, fostering innovation and expansion within DeFi. What Challenges Might Impact Future USDT Circulation? While the recovery in USDT circulation is a positive sign, it is important to acknowledge potential challenges that could influence its future trajectory. The stablecoin market operates within a rapidly evolving regulatory landscape. Governments and financial bodies worldwide are increasingly scrutinizing stablecoins, with new regulations like MiCA (Markets in Crypto-Assets) in Europe setting precedents. These regulatory shifts could impose stricter compliance requirements, potentially affecting how USDT is issued, transferred, and utilized. Competition from other stablecoins also remains a significant factor. While USDT holds the largest market share, competitors like USDC, BUSD, and DAI are continuously vying for market adoption by offering different features, audit processes, or decentralized governance models. User preference can shift based on factors such as perceived transparency, security, or integration with specific ecosystems. Furthermore, the underlying blockchain networks themselves present considerations. While Tron offers low fees, and Ethereum is foundational for DeFi, issues like network congestion, scalability limitations, or potential security vulnerabilities could impact the efficiency and reliability of USDT circulation on these platforms. Although less frequent, concerns about stablecoin peg stability, even for a robust asset like USDT, can periodically arise and influence market sentiment. Actionable Insights for Market Participants Understanding the dynamics of USDT circulation offers valuable insights for anyone involved in the crypto space: Monitor On-Chain Data: Platforms like Glassnode provide invaluable real-time data that can help you gauge market sentiment and activity. Keeping an eye on stablecoin transfer volumes can offer early signals of market shifts. Strategize Network Use: When transferring USDT, consider the trade-offs between different networks. For frequent, low-cost transactions, Tron might be preferred. For deep DeFi integrations and broader ecosystem access, Ethereum remains a strong choice. Diversify Stablecoin Holdings: While USDT is dominant, exploring other reputable stablecoins can mitigate risks associated with reliance on a single asset and offer access to different blockchain ecosystems. Stay Informed on Regulations: The regulatory environment for stablecoins is dynamic. Keeping abreast of new policies and frameworks can help you anticipate potential impacts on market access and usage. Conclusion The gradual recovery in USDT circulation , as evidenced by Glassnode’s data, marks a significant positive development for the cryptocurrency market. The surge in transfer volume to $52.9 billion signifies not just increased activity but also a growing confidence and liquidity within the stablecoin ecosystem. With Tron and Ethereum leading the charge in facilitating these transfers, the market demonstrates a robust infrastructure supporting stablecoin utility. This recovery underscores the vital role stablecoins play in providing stability, liquidity, and accessibility within the volatile crypto landscape, paving the way for continued growth and innovation. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What is USDT circulation? USDT circulation refers to the total amount of Tether (USDT) tokens actively being used and transferred across various blockchain networks. It reflects the stablecoin’s presence and movement within the cryptocurrency market, indicating its liquidity and utility. Why is USDT transfer volume important? USDT transfer volume is a crucial metric because it indicates the level of activity and demand for the stablecoin. A higher volume suggests increased trading, liquidity, and overall market confidence, serving as a barometer for the health of the stablecoin market and the broader crypto ecosystem. Which blockchain network handles the most USDT transfers? According to Glassnode data from January to May, Tron has maintained its leading spot, accounting for over 55% of the total USDT transfer volume. Ethereum follows with over 27%, primarily due to its established DeFi ecosystem. How does increased USDT circulation benefit the crypto market? Increased USDT circulation benefits the crypto market by enhancing liquidity for trading, fostering market stability, creating more efficient arbitrage opportunities, serving as an easy gateway for new users, and fueling the growth of decentralized finance (DeFi) applications. What is Glassnode and why is its data relevant? Glassnode is an on-chain market intelligence platform that provides data and insights derived directly from blockchain networks. Its data is relevant because it offers a transparent and verifiable view of cryptocurrency activity, allowing analysts and investors to understand market trends, participant behavior, and fundamental network health, contributing to EEAT principles. Did you find this analysis of USDT circulation insightful? Share this article with your network on social media to help others understand the latest trends in stablecoin activity and market recovery! title: Tether Reports $4.9B Q2 Profit and $2.6B Gains from Bitcoin, Gold Reserves
body: Tether confirmed $4.9B Q2 profit and $2.6B gains from bitcoin and gold reserves in its latest attestation. USDT’s market cap hit $163.75B, maintaining dominance as USDC, USDe, and DAI show varied growth paths. The stablecoin market surpassed $250B, reflecting rising adoption, regulatory oversight, and evolving asset backing models. Tether released its Q2 2025 attestation on July 31, revealing a significant increase in its U.S. Treasuries exposure and another multi-billion dollar profit. Tether’s U.S. Treasury Holdings Swell The attestation showed Tether’s total assets reached $162.57 billion against liabilities of $157.1 billion, resulting in a surplus of $5.47 billion in excess reserves. A key highlight is the company’s exposure to U.S. Treasuries, which climbed to $127 billion, an $8 billion increase from the previous quarter. This figure, composed of $105.5 billion in direct holdings and $21.3 billion held indirectly, positions Tether among the largest holders of U.S. government debt globally. Record Profits From Operations and Assets Tether recorded a $4.9 billion net profit for Q2, bringing its six-month total to $5.7 billion. title: Binance Alpha Unveils Exciting MOMOFUN (MM) Listing
body: BitcoinWorld Binance Alpha Unveils Exciting MOMOFUN (MM) Listing The cryptocurrency market is a dynamic landscape, constantly evolving with new innovations and promising projects emerging daily. For enthusiasts and investors, identifying these early-stage gems can be a game-changer. This is precisely where Binance Alpha steps in, acting as a crucial bridge between groundbreaking new crypto ventures and the vast Binance ecosystem. The platform has recently made waves with its announcement to add MOMOFUN (MM) on August 3, a move that highlights Binance Alpha’s commitment to fostering growth in the digital asset space. What Exactly is Binance Alpha and Its Vision? Binance Alpha is more than just a listing platform; it’s a curated showcase for early-stage crypto projects with significant potential. Integrated directly into the Binance Wallet, it offers a unique avenue for users to discover and engage with nascent tokens before they hit mainstream awareness. The vision behind Binance Alpha is clear: to provide a secure and accessible environment for promising projects to gain visibility and for users to participate in their early development. It focuses on: Early Access: Giving users a chance to discover and potentially invest in projects at their foundational stages. Curated Selection: Tokens are not randomly listed; they undergo a selection process based on community engagement and emerging market trends, ensuring a certain level of vetting. Seamless Integration: Facilitating on-chain trading directly within the familiar Binance Wallet and Exchange environment, simplifying the user experience. This dedicated approach sets Binance Alpha apart, making it a valuable resource for those looking to diversify their crypto portfolios with high-growth potential assets. The Significance of MOMOFUN (MM) Joining Binance Alpha The upcoming addition of MOMOFUN (MM) on August 3 is a testament to Binance Alpha ‘s continuous efforts to bring innovative projects to its users. While specific details about MOMOFUN (MM) itself are often revealed closer to the listing date, its selection by Binance Alpha indicates it has met the platform’s criteria for community interest and market relevance. For MOMOFUN (MM), this listing means: Increased Visibility: Exposure to millions of Binance Wallet users. Enhanced Liquidity: Access to Binance’s vast liquidity pools, crucial for any new token. Credibility Boost: Association with the Binance brand lends significant trust and legitimacy. For users, it means a new opportunity to engage with a project that has passed Binance Alpha’s initial scrutiny, potentially offering exciting prospects in line with emerging crypto trends. How Does Binance Alpha Select Promising Projects? The rigorous selection process is a cornerstone of Binance Alpha ‘s value proposition, aiming to ensure that only projects with genuine potential and strong foundations are featured. The X post by Binance specifically mentions "community engagement" and "emerging market trends" as key factors. Let’s explore what these might entail: Selection Criterion Description and Importance Community Engagement A vibrant, active community often signals strong user adoption and belief in a project’s long-term vision. This includes social media presence, developer activity, and user participation. Emerging Market Trends Projects aligned with current or anticipated industry shifts (e.g., DeFi, GameFi, NFTs, AI, ZK-tech) are more likely to gain traction and relevance. Binance Alpha seeks innovation that resonates with the market’s direction. Technological Innovation Underlying technology, scalability, security, and unique solutions offered by the project are critical. Team & Roadmap The experience and credibility of the founding team, along with a clear, achievable roadmap, instill confidence in the project’s execution capabilities. This multi-faceted evaluation process ensures that projects featured on Binance Alpha are not just novel, but also robust and well-positioned for future success. Navigating On-Chain Trading with Binance Alpha: What You Need to Know One of the key features of Binance Alpha is its seamless integration with Binance Wallet and Exchange, facilitating on-chain trading directly. This means users can engage with these early-stage tokens without needing to navigate complex external decentralized exchanges or transfer assets between multiple platforms. Here’s how it benefits users: Simplified Process: Trading is streamlined, reducing the steps and potential for errors often associated with decentralized trading. Enhanced Security: Leveraging the security infrastructure of Binance Wallet, users can trade with greater peace of mind. Direct Access to Liquidity: Being integrated with Binance Exchange means users benefit from its deep liquidity, leading to more efficient trades. However, it’s important to remember that "on-chain trading" still involves network fees (gas fees) and transaction confirmations, which can vary based on network congestion. Understanding these aspects is crucial for a smooth trading experience on Binance Alpha . Benefits for Both Investors and Projects on Binance Alpha The existence of a platform like Binance Alpha creates a symbiotic relationship, offering significant advantages to both the investors seeking opportunities and the projects aiming for growth. For Investors: Early Mover Advantage: Potential to invest in projects before wider market adoption, leading to substantial returns if the project succeeds. Diversification: Access to a new class of assets that might not be available on mainstream exchanges yet, allowing for portfolio diversification. Vetted Opportunities: While early-stage investments carry risks, Binance Alpha’s selection process provides a layer of initial vetting, potentially reducing some of the speculative elements. For Projects: Global Exposure: Immediate access to Binance’s massive global user base, providing unparalleled visibility. Liquidity & Capital: The ability to attract early investors and build liquidity, essential for project development and market stability. Credibility & Trust: Being featured on a platform associated with Binance significantly boosts a project’s credibility and trustworthiness in the eyes of the crypto community. Ecosystem Integration: Potential for deeper integration within the broader Binance ecosystem, opening doors for future collaborations and growth. Potential Risks and Considerations for Binance Alpha Users While Binance Alpha presents exciting opportunities, it’s vital to approach early-stage crypto investments with a clear understanding of the inherent risks. The crypto market, especially for new projects, is highly volatile. Users should consider the following: High Volatility: Prices of new tokens can fluctuate wildly in short periods, leading to significant gains or losses. Project Risk: Early-stage projects may fail to meet their development goals, face technical challenges, or lack sustained market interest. Liquidity Risk: While Binance Alpha aims to provide liquidity, very new tokens might still have lower trading volumes, making it harder to buy or sell large quantities without impacting price. Market Conditions: The overall crypto market sentiment can heavily influence the performance of individual tokens, regardless of their intrinsic value. It is always recommended to conduct your own thorough research (DYOR) and invest only what you can afford to lose. Understanding the whitepaper, team, technology, and long-term vision of any project, including those on Binance Alpha , is paramount. Looking Ahead: The Future of Binance Alpha and Early-Stage Crypto The continuous evolution of platforms like Binance Alpha underscores a growing trend in the crypto space: the democratization of early-stage investment. By making these opportunities more accessible and somewhat vetted, Binance Alpha plays a pivotal role in fostering innovation and supporting the next generation of blockchain projects. As the platform continues to add more promising tokens like MOMOFUN (MM), it reinforces its position as a key player in identifying and nurturing future leaders in the decentralized world. Its success will likely inspire similar models, ultimately benefiting the broader crypto ecosystem by bringing more innovative solutions to the forefront. The addition of MOMOFUN (MM) to Binance Alpha on August 3 is more than just a new listing; it’s a reaffirmation of Binance’s strategy to support cutting-edge crypto projects and provide its users with unique investment avenues. By focusing on community engagement and emerging trends, Binance Alpha is carving out a niche as a reliable gateway to the exciting, albeit volatile, world of early-stage digital assets. As the platform evolves, it promises to remain a critical resource for discovering the future of crypto. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What is Binance Alpha? Binance Alpha is a dedicated platform within the Binance Wallet that showcases and facilitates trading for early-stage crypto projects. It aims to connect innovative, nascent tokens with the broader Binance user base, offering early access opportunities. How are projects selected for Binance Alpha? Projects are selected based on rigorous criteria, primarily focusing on strong community engagement and alignment with emerging market trends. Other factors include technological innovation, the credibility of the project team, and a clear development roadmap. What is MOMOFUN (MM)? MOMOFUN (MM) is an early-stage crypto project that Binance Alpha will add on August 3. While specific details about its utility or purpose are typically revealed closer to the listing date, its selection implies it meets Binance Alpha’s criteria for potential and relevance. When will MOMOFUN (MM) be added to Binance Alpha? According to the official announcement, MOMOFUN (MM) will be added to Binance Alpha on August 3. What are the risks of investing in early-stage projects on Binance Alpha? Investing in early-stage crypto projects carries significant risks, including high volatility, the possibility of project failure, lower liquidity compared to established assets, and sensitivity to overall market conditions. Users should conduct their own research and invest cautiously. How does Binance Alpha facilitate on-chain trading? Binance Alpha integrates directly with the Binance Wallet and Exchange, allowing users to engage in on-chain trading of featured tokens seamlessly. This provides a simplified, secure, and liquid environment for interacting with these early-stage assets. title: If Dogecoin Loses This Level, Expect A Major Crash: Analyst Warns
body: A widely followed chartist says Dogecoin’s latest rally has run into textbook resistance and the memecoin now sits on a make-or-break support band that will determine whether momentum resumes or unwinds. Crypto analyst Kevin (@Kev_Capital_TA) published a daily chart on X on July 31, 2025, showing DOGE pulling back to roughly the $0.22 area after a rejection beneath $0.28. Dogecoin Must Hold This Key Zone “Dogecoin holders as you can see DOGE came up to the macro golden pocket at the major resistance of .26-.28 cents and saw a rejection similar to the rest of the altcoins market after a really nice move,” he wrote, adding that price is “retesting the big support zone you want to hold… .213-.189 is all of your major daily MA’s, weekly bull market support band and the 0.5 FIB. Hold that zone and all is well Doge will end up bouncing higher. Fail it then your going back down into the shadow realm at the .14-.12 cents level.” Related Reading: Dogecoin Eyes Breakout Above Key Trendline-Will Momentum Hold Or Fade? The accompanying chart—set to the one-day timeframe—depicts DOGE’s advance into the $0.26–$0.28 “macro golden pocket,” a term traders typically use for the 61.8%–65% Fibonacci retracement cluster that often caps counter-trend moves. Kevin’s map highlights how the rejection there coincides with a dense shelf of historical supply and a clearly defined horizontal resistance band dating back to prior distribution. The subsequent slide has brought DOGE back into a breadth of confluent supports: a cluster of key daily moving averages, the analyst’s “weekly bull market support band,” and the 50% retracement of the prior swing, all stacked between $0.213 and $0.189. Confluence of this kind—multiple widely watched signals occupying the same price zone—often becomes a battleground; a decisive defense can restore trend structure, while a breach can accelerate liquidations. Community responses pressed the analyst on consistency and risk framing. One user, @SmRatul1994, challenged the shift in tone: “You just said Doge was very well positioned a couple weeks ago. Now you’re saying the opposite which things change so quickly?” Kevin replied that his guidance has been contextual and level-driven rather than directional at all costs. “I remember telling people to take profits at .40+ cents in December a buy at .14 cents twice this year both of which produced 70+% gains and I also remember telling people to take profits at the highs both times. Don’t cry in the casino buddy. I have been saying BTC and the Altcoin market was at major resistance for over a week now,” he said. Related Reading: Dogecoin Just Flashed A Rare Weekly Bullish Signal — This Analyst Is Buying Another commenter, @anthonyzamanz, noted the market’s correlation to Bitcoin—“Also all depend where Bitcoin will go…”—to which Kevin answered, “yes sir,” underscoring the top-down dependency altcoins retain on BTC’s path. When a separate user quipped, “To summarize, dogecoin will go up, if not it will go down,” Kevin distilled the thesis back to the levels: “Hold those levels and go up if not go down. You almost had it.” In practical terms, the roadmap laid out is binary and technical. A sustained bid inside $0.213–$0.189 would argue for continuation, potentially setting up another attempt at the $0.26–$0.28 range that capped the recent push. Losing that band on convincing volume and closing structure would, in Kevin’s words, open the “shadow realm” below, with $0.14–$0.12 flagged as the next major demand pocket. For now, the chart places DOGE squarely at confluence, with bulls tasked to convert the moving-average cluster and mid-range Fibonacci support into a durable base before any serious discussion of upside resumes. As ever in altcoin cycles, the analyst and several respondents emphasized that Bitcoin’s behavior will likely arbitrate the outcome. At press time, DOGE traded at $0.205. Featured image created with DALL.E, chart from TradingView.com

title: USDT Transfer: Massive $228 Million Inflow to Binance Sparks Market Buzz
body: BitcoinWorld USDT Transfer: Massive $228 Million Inflow to Binance Sparks Market Buzz The cryptocurrency world often operates on a grand scale, with transactions that can shift millions, even hundreds of millions, of dollars in an instant. Recently, the crypto community was abuzz with news of a truly massive USDT transfer . Over 228 million USDT, valued at approximately $228 million, moved from an unknown wallet directly into Binance, one of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges. This isn’t just a large sum; it’s a significant event that prompts many questions about market dynamics, whale behavior, and what such a substantial USDT transfer might signify for the broader crypto landscape. What Exactly Happened with This USDT Transfer? The details of this particular USDT transfer were brought to light by Whale Alert, a service that tracks large cryptocurrency transactions. On a specific date, a transaction involving 228,341,879 USDT was recorded, originating from a wallet tagged as ‘unknown’ and concluding its journey on Binance. This kind of movement, especially involving a stablecoin like USDT and such a significant amount, naturally draws attention. It highlights the transparency of blockchain technology, where even anonymous movements leave a public record for all to see. Here’s a breakdown of the key facts about this USDT transfer : Amount Transferred: 228,341,879 USDT Approximate Value: $228 million Origin Wallet: Unknown Destination: Binance Exchange Reported By: Whale Alert Such a substantial USDT transfer to a major exchange like Binance can have various implications, from increasing liquidity to signaling potential market moves. Understanding these possibilities is crucial for anyone tracking the crypto market. Why Does a Large USDT Transfer to Binance Matter? A USDT transfer of this magnitude is not a common occurrence, and its implications ripple through the market. USDT, or Tether, is a stablecoin pegged to the US dollar, meaning its value is intended to remain stable at $1. This stability makes it a preferred medium for large-scale transfers, allowing whales and institutions to move significant value without exposure to crypto price volatility. When such a large amount lands on an exchange, it typically indicates a preparation for action. Consider these points regarding the impact of a large USDT transfer : Increased Liquidity: A large inflow of USDT means Binance has more stablecoin reserves, which can facilitate larger trading volumes for various cryptocurrencies. Potential Buying Pressure: Whales often move stablecoins to exchanges when they intend to buy other cryptocurrencies. This could signal an upcoming accumulation phase, potentially leading to upward price pressure. Potential Selling Pressure: Conversely, the USDT could be moved to facilitate the sale of other crypto assets, converting them into a stable asset. This is less likely if the funds originate from an ‘unknown’ wallet and are moving *to* an exchange. Arbitrage Opportunities: Large transfers can sometimes be related to exploiting price differences between exchanges. OTC Deals: Over-the-counter (OTC) desks on exchanges often handle large block trades that don’t directly impact the public order book, and this USDT transfer could be a precursor to such a deal. Understanding USDT: The Backbone of Large Crypto Transfers To fully grasp the significance of this USDT transfer , it’s important to understand what USDT is and why it’s so widely used. USDT is the largest stablecoin by market capitalization, designed to maintain a 1:1 peg with the US dollar. This stability makes it an indispensable tool in the volatile crypto market. Traders use USDT to: Hedge Against Volatility: Convert volatile cryptocurrencies into USDT during market downturns without cashing out to fiat. Facilitate Trading: Many trading pairs on exchanges are denominated in USDT, making it a common base currency. Execute Large Transfers: As seen with this transaction, USDT enables the efficient and stable movement of large sums across different exchanges or wallets. The reliability and widespread acceptance of USDT make it the go-to asset for large-scale financial maneuvers within the crypto ecosystem, including significant movements like this recent USDT transfer . Who Are Crypto Whales and What Do They Do with a USDT Transfer? In the crypto world, ‘whales’ are individuals or entities holding substantial amounts of cryptocurrency. Their large holdings mean their transactions, like this massive USDT transfer , can significantly influence market sentiment and price action. Whales are often sophisticated investors, institutions, or early adopters who have accumulated vast wealth in crypto. When a whale executes a large USDT transfer to an exchange, it’s a strong signal that they are preparing for a major move. This could be: Whale Activity Potential Motivation for USDT Transfer Accumulation Preparing to buy a large amount of Bitcoin or altcoins. Distribution Moving funds to facilitate large sales of other assets, though less common for inflows. Market Making Providing liquidity for trading pairs, earning from bid-ask spreads. OTC Trading Settling large, private trades outside the open market. Tracking these whale movements, particularly a substantial USDT transfer , provides a glimpse into the intentions of major market players, offering valuable, albeit speculative, insights. Analyzing Potential Motives Behind This Specific USDT Transfer While the exact intentions behind this 228 million USDT transfer remain unknown, we can speculate on several common motives for such large movements: Is it a Sign of Impending Purchases? One of the most common interpretations of a large stablecoin inflow to an exchange is that the holder intends to purchase other cryptocurrencies. If a whale believes the market is at a good entry point, they might move significant stablecoin reserves to an exchange to capitalize on potential price increases. This could signal a bullish outlook from a major player, suggesting they are ‘buying the dip’ or positioning themselves for an anticipated rally. Could it be Related to Arbitrage or Exchange Operations? Another possibility is that the USDT transfer is part of an arbitrage strategy. Differences in asset prices across various exchanges can create opportunities for profit. A whale might move USDT to an exchange where a particular asset is cheaper, buy it, and then transfer it to another exchange where it can be sold at a higher price. Alternatively, this could be an internal transfer by Binance itself, or a large market maker, adjusting liquidity across their various wallets or preparing for operational needs. Given the ‘unknown wallet’ tag, it is more likely an external entity. What About OTC Deals? Large institutional or high-net-worth individual trades often occur off-exchange through OTC desks to avoid impacting market prices. A significant USDT transfer to an exchange could be the initial step in settling such a private deal. For instance, an institution might have agreed to purchase a large block of Bitcoin, and this USDT is being moved to Binance’s OTC desk to facilitate the transaction. These deals do not typically show up on public order books, making the inbound stablecoin movement the only visible sign. Actionable Insights for Traders and Investors Following a Large USDT Transfer While a single USDT transfer doesn’t guarantee future market movements, it provides data points that informed traders and investors consider. Here are some actionable insights: Monitor Follow-Up Transactions: Keep an eye on the destination exchange (Binance in this case) for subsequent large trades involving the transferred USDT. If it’s used to buy Bitcoin or Ethereum, it could indicate a bullish sentiment. Assess Market Context: Consider the broader market conditions. Is the market currently consolidating, in a downtrend, or showing signs of recovery? A large USDT transfer can be interpreted differently depending on the prevailing market sentiment. Risk Management: Do not make investment decisions solely based on one whale transaction. Always conduct your own research, understand the risks, and use proper risk management strategies. Whale movements are indicators, not guarantees. Liquidity Impact: Understand that increased USDT liquidity on an exchange can make it easier for large orders to be filled without causing significant price slippage. Challenges in Interpreting an Unknown USDT Transfer Despite the insights we can glean, there are inherent challenges in definitively interpreting a USDT transfer from an unknown wallet. The anonymity of blockchain addresses means we cannot definitively identify the sender or their precise intentions. This leaves room for speculation and multiple interpretations. Furthermore, not every large transfer leads to immediate, dramatic market shifts. Whales might move funds in anticipation of events that don’t materialize, or their plans might change. Therefore, while tracking such movements is valuable for understanding potential market forces, it should always be part of a broader analytical framework. Concluding Thoughts on the Massive USDT Transfer The recent 228 million USDT transfer to Binance is a compelling reminder of the significant capital flows within the cryptocurrency ecosystem. While the exact motives of the ‘unknown’ sender remain a mystery, such a large stablecoin movement typically signals preparations for major market activity. Whether it’s a precursor to significant buying, an OTC deal, or an arbitrage opportunity, these whale movements provide valuable, albeit speculative, clues about the intentions of large market participants. Staying informed about these large transactions helps us understand the underlying dynamics of the crypto market, even as we acknowledge the inherent uncertainties. A visual representation of the $228 million USDT transfer. USDT Transfer: Massive $228 Million Inflow to Binance Sparks Market Buzz Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What is a USDT transfer? A USDT transfer refers to the movement of Tether (USDT), a stablecoin pegged to the US dollar, from one cryptocurrency wallet or exchange address to another. These transfers are recorded on a blockchain and can involve varying amounts, from small sums to hundreds of millions of dollars. Why are large USDT transfers significant? Large USDT transfers are significant because they often indicate major financial maneuvers by ‘whales’ – large holders of cryptocurrency. Such movements can precede large buying or selling activities, arbitrage opportunities, or institutional trades, potentially impacting market liquidity and price action. Does a large USDT transfer always mean a market pump or dump? No, a large USDT transfer does not automatically guarantee a market pump (price increase) or dump (price decrease). While it often signals an intention for major trading activity, the exact outcome depends on the whale’s specific strategy, broader market conditions, and whether the funds are used for buying, selling, or other purposes like OTC deals or liquidity provision. How can I track large USDT transfers? You can track large USDT transfers using blockchain explorers or dedicated whale tracking services like Whale Alert. These platforms monitor public blockchain data and report significant transactions, providing insights into large movements of various cryptocurrencies, including USDT. What is Binance’s role in a USDT transfer of this size? Binance, as one of the largest cryptocurrency exchanges, serves as a primary destination for such a massive USDT transfer. It acts as a hub where users can convert stablecoins into other cryptocurrencies, facilitate large trades (including OTC), and manage their digital assets, providing the necessary liquidity and infrastructure for these significant transactions. Did you find this analysis of the recent USDT transfer insightful? Share this article with your friends and fellow crypto enthusiasts on social media to spread awareness about significant market movements! title: Binance Alpha Unveils Exciting Toshi (TOSHI) Addition
body: BitcoinWorld Binance Alpha Unveils Exciting Toshi (TOSHI) Addition The cryptocurrency world is constantly evolving, with new projects emerging daily. For many enthusiasts, the thrill lies in discovering these early gems before they hit the mainstream. This is precisely where platforms like Binance Alpha come into play, offering a curated glimpse into the future of decentralized finance. Recently, the buzz amplified with the announcement that Binance Alpha , an innovative platform within the Binance Wallet ecosystem, has officially added Toshi (TOSHI) to its showcase. This move is more than just a new listing; it signifies a strategic step in bringing promising, community-driven projects directly to a wider audience, facilitating seamless on-chain trading. What is Binance Alpha and Why Does it Matter? Binance Alpha is not your typical exchange listing platform. It functions as a dedicated space within the Binance Wallet, designed to spotlight early-stage crypto projects that show significant potential. The selection process for these tokens is meticulous, focusing heavily on robust community engagement and alignment with emerging market trends. This approach allows Binance to act as a discovery engine, providing its vast user base with early access to tokens that might otherwise remain undiscovered by many. By integrating on-chain trading directly into the Binance Wallet and Exchange, Binance Alpha simplifies the user experience, making it easier to engage with these nascent assets. Consider the landscape of crypto project discovery. Traditionally, finding promising early-stage tokens often involved navigating complex decentralized exchanges, dealing with high gas fees, and sifting through numerous unvetted projects. Binance Alpha aims to streamline this process, offering a more accessible and somewhat curated environment. This distinction is crucial for both project developers seeking visibility and investors looking for opportunities. Aspect Binance Alpha Approach Traditional Exchange Listing Project Stage Early-stage, emerging More established, proven Selection Criteria Community engagement, market trends Volume, market cap, regulatory compliance Trading Method On-chain via Binance Wallet/Exchange Centralized exchange order books Risk Profile Higher (potential for high reward) Lower (more stability) Toshi (TOSHI) Joins the Ranks: What Makes it Stand Out? The addition of Toshi (TOSHI) to Binance Alpha has naturally drawn attention. Toshi is a cat-themed meme coin operating on the Base blockchain, gaining traction through its active community and humorous branding. While meme coins often carry a speculative nature, Toshi has managed to build a noticeable presence within its niche. Its inclusion on Binance Alpha suggests that the platform recognizes the power of strong community backing and the potential for rapid growth that such projects can exhibit. TOSHI’s journey highlights the evolving criteria for project visibility. Beyond just technological innovation, factors like viral potential, active social media presence, and community-driven development play a significant role. For Binance Alpha, identifying projects like Toshi is about tapping into the pulse of the crypto community and offering what’s trending and engaging. Toshi (TOSHI) joins Binance Alpha, expanding early-stage crypto access. Unlocking Potential: How Does Binance Alpha Benefit Investors? For investors, the arrival of projects like Toshi on Binance Alpha presents several compelling advantages. The primary benefit is early access. Investing in projects at their nascent stages can offer substantial returns if the project gains wider adoption and its value appreciates. Binance Alpha’s curated selection process, while not a guarantee of success, does provide a layer of initial vetting that can help users navigate the often-risky early crypto market. Key benefits for investors include: Early Discovery: Access to projects before they become widely known, potentially leading to higher returns. Streamlined Access: Direct on-chain trading integration within the familiar Binance Wallet and Exchange environment, simplifying the process of acquiring and managing these tokens. Community-Driven Focus: Projects selected often have strong, engaged communities, which can be a vital indicator of long-term viability and growth potential. Reduced Friction: Eliminates the need to navigate multiple decentralized platforms for early-stage investments. Navigating the Waters: What Are the Risks of Early-Stage Crypto on Binance Alpha? While the potential rewards are significant, it is crucial for investors to understand the inherent risks associated with early-stage crypto projects, even those featured on Binance Alpha . The very nature of ‘early-stage’ implies a higher degree of volatility and uncertainty. Projects can fail, liquidity can be low, and market sentiment can shift rapidly. Meme coins, in particular, are highly speculative and their value can be driven more by social trends than fundamental utility. Here are some considerations for navigating this space: High Volatility: Prices can fluctuate wildly, leading to rapid gains or losses. Project Failure: Not all early projects succeed; some may even be abandoned or prove to be scams. Liquidity Issues: Early tokens might have limited trading volume, making it difficult to buy or sell large amounts without impacting the price. Market Hype: Decisions based purely on hype without fundamental research can lead to poor outcomes. It is paramount for any investor to conduct their own thorough research (DYOR) before committing capital. Diversifying investments and only investing what you can afford to lose are fundamental principles in this high-risk, high-reward environment. The Future Landscape: What’s Next for Binance Alpha and Early Crypto Adoption? The strategic move by Binance to expand its Binance Alpha platform and include projects like Toshi underscores a broader trend in the crypto industry: the increasing focus on user accessibility and the democratization of early-stage investment opportunities. As the crypto market matures, platforms that can efficiently bridge the gap between innovative new projects and a global investor base will play a pivotal role. Binance Alpha could evolve into a primary gateway for emerging blockchain technologies and tokens, fostering innovation by providing crucial visibility and liquidity to projects that are still in their foundational phases. This not only benefits the projects themselves but also allows the wider crypto community to participate in the growth of the next big trends, from DeFi to NFTs and beyond. The future of early crypto adoption looks set to be more integrated and user-friendly, with platforms like Binance Alpha leading the charge. Conclusion The addition of Toshi (TOSHI) to Binance Alpha marks a significant development for both the project and the broader crypto community. It highlights Binance’s commitment to fostering innovation and providing early access to promising digital assets through its Wallet ecosystem. While the allure of early-stage investments is strong, potential participants must approach these opportunities with a clear understanding of the associated risks and a commitment to thorough due diligence. As Binance Alpha continues to evolve, it stands poised to shape the landscape of early crypto discovery and on-chain trading, making the journey into new frontiers of decentralized finance more accessible for everyone. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What is Binance Alpha? Binance Alpha is a platform within the Binance Wallet ecosystem designed to showcase and facilitate on-chain trading for early-stage crypto projects selected based on community engagement and emerging market trends. How are projects like Toshi selected for Binance Alpha? Projects are chosen based on criteria such as strong community engagement, alignment with current market trends, and their potential for growth, as determined by Binance’s internal assessment. Is Toshi (TOSHI) available for trading on the main Binance exchange? Currently, Toshi (TOSHI) has been added to Binance Alpha, which focuses on early-stage projects and facilitates on-chain trading via the Binance Wallet. Its availability on the main Binance exchange would be subject to separate listing decisions. What are the risks of investing in early-stage projects on Binance Alpha? Early-stage projects carry higher risks, including significant price volatility, potential for project failure, and lower liquidity compared to more established assets. Investors should conduct their own research and understand these risks. How does on-chain trading work within Binance Wallet? On-chain trading within Binance Wallet allows users to directly interact with decentralized protocols and smart contracts using their wallet funds, enabling direct token swaps and other decentralized finance (DeFi) activities without needing to transfer assets to a centralized exchange’s order book. title: Is MUTM the next Solana? Analysts target $3 by Q2 2026
body: Analysts now see echoes of that same growth story in a rising DeFi project— Mutuum Finance (MUTM) . While Solana disrupted Layer-1 infrastructure with raw speed, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is emerging with a new disruptive element: sustainable real yield at scale. Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is building a utility-first ecosystem. Its smart contract infrastructure is designed for scalability, and it enables users to lend, borrow, and stake with clear and predictable returns. This isn’t about inflated APRs that collapse in bear markets—Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is introducing mechanisms like protocol revenue buybacks, decentralized stablecoin issuance, and a Layer-2 deployment that brings down transaction fees. These components have laid the foundation for a strong price trajectory. With its token still in Phase 6 of presale, priced at $0.035, analysts are forecasting a future price of $3 before Q2 2026. That’s an 85x from current levels. Protocol mechanics that drive adoption What’s attracting serious attention to Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is its upcoming innovative dual-model lending system. The Peer-to-Contract (P2C) mechanism offers a low-risk, passive income path for users who want yield without needing to negotiate terms. For instance, a lender depositing 3 Chainlink (LINK) tokens—currently may then be worth around $42 each—earns approximately 12% APY, translating to about $15 in annual yield. This yield is generated from actual borrowing demand, not speculative incentives, creating a dependable return model. On the borrower side, the same platform allows users to access liquidity without losing asset exposure. A user holding $5,000 worth of USDC can secure a loan of $4,000 at an 80% Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio. There’s no forced repayment schedule; users repay when it suits them, while automated smart contracts handle liquidation based on a risk-adjusted Stability Factor. This makes Mutuum ideal for long-term holders of blue-chip assets looking to unlock capital. Beyond that, the Peer-to-Peer (P2P) lending system is designed for higher-yield seekers and involves memcoins like FLOKI, TRUMP, and SHIB. It connects borrowers and lenders directly, enabling tailored deals with agreed interest rates and terms. It’s a more hands-on approach but gives participants more flexibility and the potential for outsized returns. Together, these models reflect a DeFi ecosystem that accommodates both risk-averse users and aggressive yield hunters, something that even established protocols often struggle to balance. Tokenomics, presale status & growth engine With utility locked in, attention is turning to the numbers—and they’re pointing up. The project is in Phase 6 of its presale, with the MUTM token priced at $0.035. So far, over 14,700 holders have joined the ecosystem, and 7% of the Phase 6 allocation has already been purchased. The next price jump, set at $0.040 in Phase 7, marks a 15% gain for those who act now. But the real advantage goes to early participants. Investors from Phase 1—when the token was just $0.01—are already sitting on a 250% unrealized gain. At a future $3 price target, that would translate to a 300x return. Even at the current Phase 6 price, the path to $3 means an 85x upside—a clear incentive for newcomers to enter before the presale concludes and exchange listings go live. Those listings are expected to include Binance, KuCoin, and MEXC, positioning the token for serious visibility across global retail and institutional investors. At launch, the listing price will be $0.06, which alone represents a 70% jump from the current $0.035 price. On top of all this, the protocol introduces a smart buy-and-distribute mechanism. Revenue earned from borrower interest is used to buy MUTM tokens from the open market. These are then redistributed to mtTokens stakers in the smart contracts, which represent staked assets in the system. This model creates a consistent demand driver for the token while rewarding long-term participants with increasing value and yield. The project also features a $100,000 giveaway , where ten winners will receive $10,000 worth of MUTM tokens—a bold campaign to grow awareness and reward early believers. A separate $50,000 bug bounty with CertiK reinforces the project’s security-first approach. The audit includes manual code reviews, static analysis, and two key metrics: a Token Scan score of 95 and a Skynet rating of 78. Final words Solana succeeded by solving a core problem of blockchain speed and scalability, and early adopters were rewarded exponentially. Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is on track to replicate that trajectory, this time in the lending and borrowing arena. Its combination of real-world yield, flexible borrowing, and upcoming Layer-2 deployment has already attracted the attention of thousands. As exchange listings approach, the $0.035 presale entry point won’t last much longer. When MUTM goes live at $0.06 and starts climbing, the chance to enter early, just like Solana, it will be gone. For more information about Mutuum Finance (MUTM) visit the links below: Website: https://www.mutuum.com Linktree: https://linktr.ee/mutuumfinance The post Is MUTM the next Solana? Analysts target $3 by Q2 2026 appeared first on Invezz

title: Next Crypto to Explode 100x: Mutuum Finance (MUTM) or Dogecoin (DOGE)?
body: As the summer heat blazes on, all eyes are turning to Mutuum Finance (MUTM) and Dogecoin. Mutuum Finance is in presale phase 6 at $0.035, a 16.17% price hike from the previous phase. The price will rise by 14.29% to $0.04 in phase 7. Investors who enter at this point are guaranteed a 71.43% return on investment at launch at $0.06. Mutuum Finance presale has generated over $13.8 million and has been bought by more than 14700 unique holders. Mutuum Finance could 100x sooner than Dogecoin. title: Four Russian oil tankers stalled off India’s coast
body: Four oil tankers carrying Russia’s Urals crude are currently stranded off the coast of western India, as local refiners wait for directions from the government following new pressure from President Donald Trump. The vessels—Achilles, Elyte, Destan, and Horae—loaded their cargo in late June, but have yet to dock, with plans disrupted by fresh sanctions and tariff threats out of Washington. According to reporting from Bloomberg , the ships are sitting off Jamnagar, close to Sikka port, which serves Reliance Industries Ltd. and Bharat Petroleum Corp. Ltd. Trump’s White House announced this week that it was slapping new import duties on India in response to its continued purchase of Russian oil. That announcement came after the European Union issued another wave of penalties targeting Russia last month. The administration also warned that further penalties could follow if India doesn’t scale back those oil imports. India orders refiners to find alternatives as Trump escalates Achilles and Elyte, both Aframax-class tankers, were scheduled to discharge at Sikka on August 2 and 3. Each ship can carry around 700,000 barrels, and both loaded cargo at Primorsk and Ust Luga, key Russian export terminals. Both vessels have already been sanctioned by the EU and UK, adding further risk for Indian refiners caught in the middle. Following the announcement from Trump’s administration, New Delhi directed refiners to come up with new plans for sourcing oil. Government officials have asked the companies to share strategies for securing crude from countries not targeted by sanctions. The instruction signals that India is trying to avoid being directly hit by Trump’s unspecified future penalties. Destan and Horae, also Aframaxes, are floating farther from shore with Urals crude in their tanks. They picked up cargo between June 24 and July 1, based on ship-tracking information. Destan, like Achilles and Elyte, is under EU and UK sanctions. It’s expected to reach Sikka soon. Horae, on the other hand, has not been sanctioned by any major Western government. But its destination is still unclear, and the uncertainty surrounding Trump’s evolving position on Russia is forcing all players to stay cautious. Indian officials are watching closely to see if Washington moves to expand its sanctions framework further. The growing concern among refiners stems from Trump’s remarks delivered at the White House on Thursday afternoon. When asked about the situation, Trump said his foreign envoy, Steve Witkoff, would soon be heading to Russia. “He’s going to Russia, believe it or not,” Trump told reporters, revealing the trip publicly for the first time. Witkoff is currently in the Middle East discussing the conflict in Gaza, but Trump said the envoy will shift his focus to Moscow as part of the president’s push to end the war in Ukraine. Witkoff last visited Russia in April, when he held talks with President Vladimir Putin at the Kremlin. Those discussions did not result in any deal. Trump warns of more sanctions, doubts their impact Tensions have since escalated. Trump has grown frustrated with Putin and was blunt when asked about Russia’s latest attacks on Kyiv. “I think it’s disgusting what they’re doing. I think it’s disgusting,” Trump said, referring to missile and drone barrages launched by Moscow this week. He confirmed plans for new sanctions and repeated his earlier threat to impose them if Russia didn’t commit to a peace deal by the end of the week. But he also questioned how effective they would be. “Yeah, we’re going to put sanctions,” Trump said. “I don’t know that sanctions bother him. You know, they know about sanctions. I know better than anybody about sanctions and tariffs and everything else. I don’t know if that has any effect, but we’re going to do it.” The uncertainty around how far Trump is willing to go has left Indian refiners in a holding pattern. The four Russia-linked tankers near India now represent more than 2.8 million barrels of oil waiting for instructions. For now, the cargo remains onboard, and no final decisions have been made. title: Jamie Dimon Softens Crypto Stance, Backs Stablecoins and Blockchain
body: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon signaled a notable shift in his views on digital assets during a CNBC interview on Tuesday, saying he now believes in the utility of stablecoins and sees value in blockchain technology. While Dimon stopped short of endorsing crypto like Bitcoin, his comments reflect a more accommodating stance shaped by growing client demand. “It’s what the customer wants, not what JPMorgan wants,” Dimon stated, emphasizing that the bank’s crypto initiatives are being driven by market demand rather than internal conviction. He acknowledged that all financial innovations carry risk, saying, “There’s never been a new financial product that didn’t entail risk.” JPMorgan has already begun laying the groundwork for broader participation in the digital asset space. In July, Dimon confirmed plans for the bank to experiment with its own deposit coin and expand into stablecoin issuance—moves aimed at gaining a deeper understanding of the ecosystem and becoming proficient in its operation. From Critic to Cautious Participant Dimon’s latest remarks mark a significant departure from his earlier, more hostile stance on the industry. In 2017, he infamously labeled Bitcoin a “fraud,” likening it to the Dutch tulip mania of the 1600s and even threatening to fire JPMorgan traders who dabbled in crypto. By 2018, while he remained critical of Bitcoin and its use in illicit finance , he conceded that blockchain technology might hold legitimate promise. Even as recently as January 2024, at the World Economic Forum, Dimon dismissed Bitcoin as having “no intrinsic value.” In early 2025, he again criticized Bitcoin, linking it to criminal activities such as ransomware and money laundering, though he continued to voice support for the underlying blockchain. This nuanced evolution in perspective appears to mirror the broader trajectory of traditional finance, where institutions initially wary of crypto are gradually embracing certain elements under regulatory scrutiny and customer pressure. JPMorgan Expands Crypto Footprint with Coinbase Deal Reinforcing this strategic pivot, JPMorgan announced on Wednesday a partnership with Coinbase, one of the largest crypto exchanges in the U.S. Starting this fall, Chase credit card holders will be able to purchase digital assets directly via Coinbase, while also gaining the option to redeem their Chase Ultimate Rewards points for USDC, a leading stablecoin. Additionally, according to a report by the Financial Times earlier this month, the banking giant is also exploring Bitcoin-backed lending products . If greenlit, this could position JPMorgan as one of the first major U.S. banks to accept Bitcoin as collateral for loans, with a rollout possibly coming as soon as 2026. Dimon’s change in tone may still surprise crypto purists, but the bank’s accelerating involvement in digital finance suggests that a full embrace of select crypto services is no longer a matter of if—but when. The post Jamie Dimon Softens Crypto Stance, Backs Stablecoins and Blockchain appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .
