title: 10 best methods for crypto passive income: Tested & effective
body: Imagine your digital assets working for you, generating returns while you sleep. That’s the reality of crypto passive income. Beyond the volatile trading floors, savvy investors are uncovering effective strategies to accumulate wealth with minimal effort, which is the essence of this article. In it, we’ll unpack 10 proven methods for generating crypto passive income, offering clear insights to help you make your assets earn their keep. Passive Income Method Description Difficulty Cloud Mining Piggyback on established mining ventures to draw crypto rewards. Easy Staking Earn staking rewards by locking your crypto holdings on reputable PoS blockchain projects. Easy Yield Farming Allocate your crypto holdings across decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols for maximum profit. Medium to difficult Liquidity Provision/Mining Fund the daily running of a decentralized crypto exchange (DEX) like PancakeSwap, UniSwap, and Fluid to generate passive income. Easy Master Node Operation Generate passive income by running a specialized server for compensation in cryptocurrency. Difficult Crypto Lending Loan your digital assets on crypto lending platforms, including Aave, Nexo, and Compound. Medium Crypto Saving Account Attract interest on your crypto deposits, akin to your savings account in traditional finance (TradFi). Easy NFT Royalties Receive payouts with every subsequent sale/rental of your digital art or collectible. Medium to difficult Tokenization Invest in fractionalized real-world assets (RWA) or digital securities that generate passive income. Medium to difficult Dividend Paying Tokens Invest in a crypto project that periodically pays you and other token holders a portion of its income. Easy Top passive income in crypto options Ready to put your crypto to work? Let’s explore these powerful passive income strategies, examining how they work, their benefits, and potential drawbacks. Cloud mining: Cloud mining offers a way to participate in cryptocurrency mining without owning or managing hardware. Instead, you rent computing power from large, established mining farms. They handle the infrastructure, electricity, network security, and maintenance. You, meanwhile, receive a share of the mined cryptocurrency proportional to your rented “hash power.” This passive income generation method appeals to many because it removes the technical complexity and upfront capital expenditure of traditional mining. You purchase a contract for a certain amount of hashing power for a set period, and the cloud mining provider diverts that power to mine cryptocurrencies on your behalf. How to get started? Research Providers: Find reputable cloud mining companies. Look for transparency in their operations and clear contract terms. Choose a Contract: Select a contract based on hash power, duration, and the cryptocurrency you wish to mine. Fund Your Account: Pay for your chosen contract with crypto or fiat currency. Receive Payouts: The provider automatically sends mining rewards to your crypto wallet . Pros and cons Pros: No Hardware Management: You avoid the costs and complexities of buying, setting up, and maintaining mining rigs. Reduced Electricity Bills: The provider covers the electricity, a major cost in traditional mining. Accessibility: Anyone can participate, regardless of technical expertise or hardware budget. Cons: High Scam Risk: The cloud mining industry has a notorious history of fraudulent schemes. Many companies have disappeared with investor funds. Lower Profitability: Even legitimate services often have high fees, making them less profitable than direct mining. Lack of Control: You have no direct control over the mining operation or the specific hardware, and often operate under fixed contracts. Staking your crypto holdings Staking is a cornerstone of passive income in the crypto world, especially with the rise of Proof-of-Stake (PoS) blockchains. You lock up your crypto holdings to support blockchain operations, confirm transactions, and maintain network integrity. In return, the network rewards you with newly minted coins or a share of transaction fees. PoS staking platforms select “validators” (the equivalent of miners in Proof-of-Work setups) based on the amount of crypto they’ve “staked.” The more crypto coins you commit, the higher your chances of being chosen to validate the next block and earn rewards. This system makes PoS blockchains more energy-efficient and scalable. How to get started? Choose a PoS Coin: To begin cryptocurrency staking, select a crypto asset that supports the process (e.g., Ethereum, Solana, Cardano). Pick a Method: Decide whether to stake directly, join a liquidity pool, use liquid staking, or stake on a cryptocurrency exchange . Transfer Funds: Move your chosen crypto to a compatible crypto wallet or exchange. Initiate Staking: Follow the platform’s instructions to lock your assets and start earning token rewards. Pros and cons Pros: Passive Earnings: Once set up, it requires minimal ongoing effort. Eco-Friendly: Proof-of-stake projects consume significantly less energy than PoW. Network Contribution: You help secure and decentralize the blockchain network. Predictable Returns: Staking rewards are often more consistent than trading profits. Cons: Lock-up Periods: Your staked tokens might be inaccessible for a period, preventing quick sales during market downturns. Slashing Risk: You could lose your staked assets if the validator you delegate to (or your node) acts maliciously or goes offline. Illiquidity: Staking crypto ties up your assets, limiting your ability to react to market changes. Yield farming: Yield farming involves strategically moving crypto assets across various decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols to maximize returns. The core idea is to use different services like lending, borrowing, and providing liquidity to a decentralized exchange (DEX), to “farm” the highest possible yield. Think of it as a digital treasure hunt, where the treasure chests are various DeFi applications offering different reward rates. How to get started with yield farming? Understand DeFi Basics: To get the best out of your yield farming venture, understand how DEXs, liquidity pools, and smart contracts work. Choose a Protocol: Select a reputable, audited DeFi protocol (e.g., Uniswap, Aave, Compound). Acquire Paired Assets: Obtain the specific token pair required for the liquidity pool you wish to join. Provide Liquidity: Deposit your tokens into the chosen liquidity pool and receive LP tokens. Stake LP Tokens (Optional): Many protocols allow you to stake these LP tokens in a “farm” to earn additional governance tokens. Pros and cons Pros: Potentially High Returns: Rewards can be very attractive, especially in newer or high-demand yield farming protocols. Diverse Earnings: You can earn transaction fees, governance tokens, and sometimes even other cryptocurrencies simultaneously. Support Decentralization: You contribute directly to the functionality and growth of the DeFi ecosystem. Cons: Impermanent Loss (Major Risk): This occurs when the price of your deposited assets changes significantly compared to when you deposited them. If one asset in the pair outperforms the other, you might end up with a lower dollar value than if you had held the assets separately. Smart Contract Risk: Smart contract vulnerabilities can lead to the loss of your funds. Rug Pulls: Malicious developers can create yield farming projects, attract large amounts of liquidity, and suddenly withdraw all the funds, leaving investors with worthless tokens. Liquidity provision/ Mining: While closely related to yield farming, liquidity provision (LP) specifically focuses on supplying assets to DEX liquidity pools. This is the fundamental act that enables decentralized trading. With this strategy, you become a crucial part of the DEX’s infrastructure, facilitating seamless token swaps for other users. When you provide liquidity, you deposit an equal value of two tokens into a designated pool. For example, if you add ETH and a stablecoin like USDC to a pool, you receive “liquidity provider (LP) tokens” as a receipt. These LP tokens represent your share of the pool. As traders execute swaps using that pool, they pay a small trading fee, which is then distributed proportionally to all LPs. How to get started? Select a DEX: Choose a reputable decentralized exchange (e.g., Uniswap, PancakeSwap, Curve). Identify a Pool: Pick a liquidity pool with a token pair you want to provide (e.g., ETH/USDC, BNB/CAKE). Deposit Equal Value: Deposit an equal dollar value of both tokens into the pool. Receive LP Tokens: The DEX issues you LP tokens, representing your stake in the pool. Earn Fees/Rewards: Automatically earn a share of trading fees and potentially additional liquidity mining rewards. Pros and cons Pros: Earn Trading Fees: You directly profit from the trading activity on the DEX. Support Decentralized Trading: You enable the core function of decentralized finance. Potential for Additional Rewards: Many platforms offer extra tokens for providing liquidity. Cons: Impermanent Loss: Price divergence between the two assets can lead to a net loss compared to simply holding them. Smart Contract Risk: Vulnerabilities in the DEX’s smart contracts could put your funds at risk. Rug Pulls: Less common for established DEXs, but new, unaudited platforms can be risky. Master node operation: Running a masternode is a more advanced and demanding form of passive income in crypto. Unlike staking, where you simply lock up coins to help validate transactions, a masternode requires you to run a specialized server 24/7 with a significant amount of a specific cryptocurrency locked up as collateral. These nodes perform unique functions beyond basic transaction validation, such as enhancing privacy, facilitating instant transactions, or participating in decentralized governance. Masternode operators receive a portion of the blockchain network’s block rewards for performing these critical services. How to get started? Choose a Masternode Coin: Research cryptocurrencies that support masternodes (e.g., Dash, PIVX, Horizen). Acquire Collateral: Obtain the required minimum amount of the specific cryptocurrency. Set Up a Server: Configure a dedicated server (often a Virtual Private Server, or VPS) with specific hardware and software requirements. Lock Collateral: Lock your crypto collateral in a designated wallet, proving your commitment to the network. Maintain Uptime: Ensure your server remains online and operational 24/7 to continue earning rewards. Pros and cons Pros: Higher Potential Rewards: Masternode rewards can be substantial due to the higher barrier to entry and specialized services provided. Network Governance: You often gain voting rights in the project’s decentralized governance, influencing its future direction. Support Network Functionality: You contribute to advanced features and stability of the blockchain network. Cons: High Capital Requirement: Masternodes often require a large initial investment in the cryptocurrency collateral. Technical Complexity: Setting up and maintaining a server requires significant technical knowledge. Volatile Markets: The value of your locked collateral can fluctuate dramatically, impacting your overall investment. Security Risks: Running a server exposes you to cyber threats if it is improperly secured. Crypto lending: Crypto lending allows you to act as a bank, earning interest by lending your digital assets to others. As in traditional finance, borrowers pay interest for using your capital, and you, as the lender, receive a portion of that interest. This strategy provides a straightforward way to generate passive income from your crypto holdings without selling them. The crypto lending landscape is broadly divided into centralized (CeFi) and decentralized (DeFi). CeFi platforms like Nexo or BlockFi operate similarly to traditional banks. DeFi protocols like Aave or Compound, on the other hand, operate entirely on self-executing contracts. How to get started? Choose a Platform: Select a reputable centralized or decentralized lending platform to start the lending process. Deposit Crypto: Transfer the cryptocurrency you wish to lend to the platform’s designated address or wallet. Select Terms (if applicable): Some crypto lending platforms offer different rates for fixed vs. flexible terms. Earn Interest: The platform automatically distributes interest payments to your account. Pros and cons Pros: Relatively Simple: It’s as easy as depositing funds for centralized platforms. DeFi platforms require a bit more familiarity with wallets and smart contracts. Potentially Higher Returns: Interest rates can be significantly higher than those in traditional savings accounts. Flexible Terms: Many platforms offer flexible terms, allowing you to withdraw your assets anytime (though some may have lock-up periods for higher rates). Diversification: Another way to generate income beyond capital appreciation. Cons: Platform Risk (CeFi): You don’t control your private keys in CeFi. So, you could lose your funds if a platform goes bankrupt, gets hacked, or faces regulatory issues. Smart Contract Risk (DeFi): Vulnerabilities in the automated contracts of decentralized protocols can lead to loss of funds. Liquidation Risk (indirect): While borrowers typically put up collateral, extreme market volatility can lead to mass liquidations, potentially stressing the system. Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape for crypto lending is still evolving, which can introduce risks. Investing in crypto saving accounts: Crypto savings accounts offer one of the most straightforward ways to earn passive income. They function much like a traditional bank savings account, but instead of fiat currency, you deposit cryptocurrencies. In return, the platform pays you interest on your holdings. This method particularly appeals to those who prefer simplicity and are looking for a low-effort way to grow their crypto portfolio. These accounts are typically offered by centralized crypto exchanges or dedicated CeFi lending platforms. Interest rates vary significantly based on the platform, cryptocurrency, and market dynamics, but they are often higher than what traditional banks offer. How to get started? Choose a Platform: Select a reputable exchange or CeFi platform offering crypto savings accounts. Deposit Crypto: Transfer your crypto assets into the savings account. Select Terms: Some accounts offer flexible or fixed-term options. Earn Interest: Interest accrues and is typically paid daily, weekly, or monthly. Pros and cons Pros: Simplicity: Very easy to set up and manage, requiring minimal technical knowledge. Consistent Income: Regular interest payments give you a steady income stream. Higher Interest Rates: Often offer better returns compared to traditional bank accounts. No Active Management: Your funds earn passively without further action once deposited. Cons: Centralization Risk: You entrust your funds to a third party, exposing you to platform hacks, insolvency, or regulatory issues. Lack of Control: You do not hold your private keys; the platform has custody of your assets. Variable Rates: Interest rates can change based on market conditions, sometimes without much notice. Withdrawal Limits/Fees: Some platforms might impose limits or fees on withdrawals. NFT royalties: Non-fungible tokens (NFTs) royalties offer a fascinating passive income stream for their creators and original owners. Unlike traditional art, where artists rarely profit from secondary sales, NFTs are designed with contracts that can automatically enforce royalty payments. Every time your digital art or collectible resells, you, the original creator, or a designated beneficiary, receive a percentage of that sale price. Some NFT projects also allow for “staking” NFTs to earn rewards or “renting” them out, particularly in play-to-earn (P2E) gaming or metaverse environments. In these strategies, the renter pays a fee for their temporary use. How to get started? Create/Acquire NFTs: Mint NFTs or purchase them from collections that offer royalties or rental utility. Set Royalties (for creators): If you’re a creator, define your royalty percentage during the minting process on platforms like OpenSea or Rarible. List on Marketplaces: List your NFTs on marketplaces that support royalty enforcement. Enable Rental (if applicable): For utility NFTs, explore platforms that facilitate NFT rentals. Pros and cons Pros: Long-Term Income for Creators: Provides a continuous income stream from secondary sales of your digital creations. Monetize Digital Assets: Allows NFT holders to earn from their collectibles beyond just selling them. Utility for NFTs: Gives NFTs more functionality beyond just being collectibles, especially for gaming or metaverse assets. Cons: Volatile Markets: The value of NFTs can fluctuate wildly, impacting the total royalty amount. Platform Dependency: Royalties are typically enforced by marketplaces, and not all platforms fully support them. Smart Contract Risk: As with other blockchain applications, vulnerabilities in NFT smart contracts can pose risks. Liquidity Risk: Your NFT might be illiquid if locked in a staking protocol or rented out. Tokenization: Tokenization involves converting real-world assets (RWAs) or traditional securities ownership rights into digital tokens on a blockchain. This process creates a digital representation of an asset, making it divisible, easily transferable, and potentially income-generating. For passive income, tokenization opens doors to investing in assets that traditionally have high entry barriers, like real estate, fine art, or even intellectual property. These tokens can represent equity, debt, or a share of future revenues from the underlying asset. The passive income comes from distributing profits, dividends, or rental income generated by the RWA, directly to the token holders. How to get started? Research Tokenized Asset Platforms: Find platforms specializing in tokenized real estate, art, or other income-generating RWAs. Understand the Asset: Thoroughly research the underlying real-world asset and its income generation model. Acquire Tokens: Purchase fractionalized tokens representing ownership or a claim on their income. Receive Distributions: The platform automatically distributes income to your crypto wallet. Pros and cons Pros: Access to Illiquid Assets: Allows fractional ownership and investment in assets traditionally inaccessible to average investors (e.g., high-value real estate). Transparent Ownership: Blockchain provides immutable and transparent records of ownership. Potential for Stable Income: Income is tied to real-world assets, offering you steady income compared to purely crypto-native yields. Diversification: Adds a new layer of diversification to a crypto portfolio by connecting it to tangible assets. Cons: Regulatory Uncertainty: The legal framework for tokenized securities and RWAs is still evolving and varies by jurisdiction. Liquidity Challenges: While tokens are more liquid than the underlying asset, the secondary market for some tokenized assets might still be limited. Platform Risk: You rely on the platform issuing the tokens to manage the underlying asset and distribute income correctly. Complexity: Understanding the legal and financial structures behind tokenized assets requires careful research. Dividend-paying tokens: Like traditional stocks, some cryptocurrencies are designed to pay “dividends” to their holders. These aren’t just speculative assets; they represent a share in a project’s success, distributing a portion of its revenue, profits, or fees directly to crypto holders. These dividend mechanisms are typically hardcoded into the token’s smart contract or managed by the project’s treasury. You simply need to hold the token in a compatible wallet, and the dividends are periodically distributed to you, often in the native token or another cryptocurrency like a stablecoin. How to get started? Identify Dividend Tokens: Research crypto projects designed to pay dividends or distribute revenue to holders. Understand Payout Mechanism: Learn how dividends are generated, calculated, and distributed. Acquire Tokens: Purchase the dividend-paying tokens from a reputable centralized or decentralized platform. Hold in Compatible Wallet: Ensure your tokens are in a wallet that supports the dividend distribution mechanism. Pros and cons Pros: Direct Share in Project Success: You benefit directly from the project’s profitability and growth. Passive Income Stream: Earnings are distributed periodically without requiring active management. Incentive to Hold: Encourages long-term holding, potentially aligning your interests with the project’s success. Diversification: Adds a different type of income stream to your crypto portfolio. Cons: Project Performance Risk: If the underlying project fails or its revenue declines, dividend payouts will decrease or stop. Token Price Volatility: The value of the dividend-paying token itself can fluctuate, impacting your overall investment. Regulatory Scrutiny: Dividend-paying tokens can sometimes resemble securities, attracting stricter regulatory oversight. Inflationary Rewards: Some “dividends” might come from newly minted tokens, which could dilute the token’s value if not managed properly. Is crypto good for passive income? Absolutely. Crypto presents a compelling landscape for passive income, offering unique advantages over traditional finance. For instance, staking allows you to earn rewards by holding and supporting a network, much like a silent partner in a thriving digital enterprise. Yield farming, while more complex, can amplify returns by leveraging multiple DeFi protocols, turning your idle assets into active income generators. These methods provide a powerful way to compound your crypto holdings, allowing your initial investment to grow exponentially. Moreover, crypto passive income strategies offer a degree of accessibility and transparency often absent in traditional markets. Many opportunities are open to investors with varying capital sizes, not just institutional players. DeFi protocols, in particular, operate on transparent self-executing contracts, a level of openness that fosters trust and empowers individual investors. While risks are inherent, the potential for substantial growth and the innovative nature of these income streams make crypto a highly attractive frontier for passive wealth generation. Taxes on crypto passive income Many countries recognize digital assets as property or investment, not just a currency. Thus, you are legally obligated to report your ownership, acquisition, and any income derived from them to tax authorities. Failing to do so can result in serious consequences, including penalties, legal action, or jail time in some jurisdictions. Note that tax agencies worldwide are becoming increasingly sophisticated in tracking crypto transactions, so transparency is key. To stay compliant, first, understand your country’s specific rules on cryptocurrency taxation. These vary widely, so consult local tax guidelines or a crypto-savvy professional to understand the tax implications of your holdings. Second, meticulously record all your crypto transactions, including dates, amounts, types of crypto, and their fiat value at the time of the transaction. Finally, remit your taxes and file your returns accurately and on time. Fortunately, various crypto tax management tools, like CoinTracker or Koinly, can help automate record-keeping and tax calculations, simplifying the process significantly. Depending on your jurisdiction and the nature of your crypto activities, you might encounter several types of taxes: Income Tax: Applies to earnings from crypto staking rewards, yield farming profits, lending interest, masternode rewards, and potentially airdrops. Capital Gains Tax: Applies when you sell, swap, or spend crypto for a profit. Sales Tax (VAT/GST): In some regions, using crypto to purchase goods or services might incur a sales tax, similar to traditional purchases. Wealth Tax: A few countries impose a tax on an individual’s total net worth, which could include their crypto holdings. Gift or Inheritance Tax: Giving or receiving large amounts of crypto as a gift or inheriting crypto can trigger specific tax obligations for the giver or recipient. Wrapping it up Earning passive income with crypto offers an exciting way to make your digital assets work harder for you. From the steady rhythm of staking to the dynamic world of yield farming and the emerging opportunities in NFTs and tokenization, plenty of avenues exist to explore. This space moves fast, and it’s decentralized, so you need to be smart and informed. Being successful at earning passive crypto income means doing your homework, managing your risks, and being super serious about security.

title: Cryptocurrency Exchanges Reach Highest Trading Volume Since February! Here's the Top Crypto Exchange!
body: Trading volume in cryptocurrency markets increased significantly in July, reaching a total of $1.71 trillion. This figure marked the highest monthly trading volume since February 2025. $1.7 Trillion in Volume on Cryptocurrency Exchanges in July: Highest Level Since February Trading volume in July increased by 55% compared to June, rising from $1.1 trillion to $1.71 trillion. This volume is very similar to the $1.77 trillion recorded in February. Binance maintained its leadership as the exchange with the highest trading volume in July. Binance's trading volume reached $683.41 billion, its highest since January's $801.1 billion. Bitget followed with $126.05 billion, Bybit with $122.3 billion, and Upbit with $110.21 billion. This surge in trading volume coincided with a general rise in crypto markets. Bitcoin reached its highest monthly close in history at $115,644 at the end of July, gaining approximately 7.5% over the month. Ethereum (ETH) saw an even stronger 49.5% increase during the same period. Meanwhile, trading volume on decentralized exchanges (DEXs) also attracted attention. DEX volume reached $435.3 billion in July, its highest level since January. PancakeSwap led the way in this area with $188.6 billion in trading volume. *This is not investment advice. title: XRP plunges below $3 erasing billions overnight
body: XRP price plunged below the critical $3 threshold early Friday as the broader cryptocurrency market reacted sharply to U.S. President Donald Trump’s newly imposed tariffs on multiple countries, sparking fears of escalating global economic tensions. The sell-off, which also rattled equities, combined macroeconomic uncertainty with profit-taking after XRP’s recent highs. In particular, the token fell from an intraday peak of $3.16 to a low of $2.92, wiping out more than $13 billion in market value as its capitalization dropped from $186.6 billion to $173.3 billion in just hours. XRP market cap. Source: CoinMarketCap The breach of the $3 mark was a technically significant event. Psychological levels like $3 tend to act as magnets for liquidity. Once broken, they can accelerate momentum-driven selling, especially in a macro-driven sell-off like this. 24 hour volume ($8.1 billion up nearly 24%) shows that the sell-off wasn’t a quiet drift, it was high-volume, panic-driven trading, confirming real conviction behind the move. Ripple institutional developments Still, the bearish pressure comes against the backdrop of major institutional developments. As reported earlier this today, BlackRock’s Director of Digital Assets, Maxwell Stein, is set to speak at Ripple’s SWELL 2025 conference in London, fueling speculation that the asset manager could explore an XRP exchange-traded fund ( ETF ) in the future. This institutional interest has some traders seeing the current pullback as a potential buying opportunity if Ripple’s regulatory and partnership milestones continue to align. For now, the key question is whether XRP can reclaim the $3 level and stabilize ahead of Ripple’s upcoming token unlock and the October SWELL event, which could act as catalysts for renewed bullish momentum. The post XRP plunges below $3 erasing billions overnight appeared first on Finbold .

title: $15 Still in Sight for XRP—As Long As $2.47 Holds the Line
body: All Eyes on XRP’s Bull Flag Formation XRP appears to be tracing a classic bull flag pattern, an established continuation setup that could set the stage for a massive breakout, according to leading crypto analyst Irma Analytics. The formation, which followed a strong rally from $2.10 to $3.50, mirrors a similar technical setup that previously preceded a 400% surge in XRP’s price. Presently, XRP is consolidating just the $3.50 mark, forming tight parallel downward-sloping lines, which are hallmarks of a textbook bull flag. This pullback after a steep climb often signals market pause before the next leg upward. According to Irma Analytics, the flagpole depicted by the initial rally from $2.10 to $3.50, projects a potential breakout target between $15 and $17 if the pattern completes successfully. She pointed out, “The structure looks legit — textbook breakout + macro catalysts. First key level is $6, but if momentum sticks, $15+ is in play. The risk is real, but so is the setup.” Despite dropping below the $3 threshold, technical indicators reinforce the bullish case. XRP remains above its 20-day and 50-day exponential moving averages (EMAs), while trading volumes during the pullback have tapered, another classic bull flag characteristic. Additionally, Relative Strength Index (RSI) levels remain neutral, suggesting there's still room for upside momentum. At the time of this writing, XRP was down by 7.7% in the past 24 hours to trade at $2.92. XRP Needs to Hold $2.47 XRP is holding steady above the key support level of $2.47, reinforcing a strong bullish narrative that now sets sights on the next major upside target at $4.804. This level has emerged from technical projections following a prolonged consolidation and breakout pattern, and its validation suggests room for another 44% rally in the near term. Renowned market analyst Javon Marks pointed out , “XRP maintaining well above the $2.47 target and this means that the current target is at $4.804. With this target now in play, prices of XRP can have room to climb another +44% to reach it and a break above would bring in play the next target at precisely, $7.138.” The $4.804 target is derived from the measured move of a confirmed breakout pattern that began forming after XRP surged from $2.10 to a new all-time high of $3.65 in July. Since then, the token has consolidated in a tight range, despite falling below the $3 threshold. Should XRP break above $4.804, the next critical target comes into play at $7.138, a level that could spark even stronger buying interest, Marks pointed out. Notably, a breakdown below $2.47 would invalidate the current setup and could lead to deeper retracements. But as long as XRP maintains this support, the path to $4.804 and potentially $7.138 remains technically and fundamentally viable with $2.65 emerging as the other fundamental support zone. Conclusion If the bull flag pattern plays out as it did in the past, XRP could soon embark on a run toward $15–$17, rewriting its all-time highs and potentially reasserting itself as one of the top-performing digital assets of the current cycle. Nevertheless, XRP’s ability to maintain strength above $2.47 will play a fundamental role in enabling the 3rd-largest cryptocurrency by market cap to continue scaling new heights.

body: With the presale currently in Phase 6, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is offering its token at just $0.035. But this entry point won’t last much longer. With 7% of the current phase allocation already sold, the price will increase by 15% to $0.040 in the next stage. Backed by over 14,700 holders and more than $13.8 million raised so far, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is gaining the kind of momentum usually seen just before a breakout. AVAX whale buy Avalanche (AVAX) surged 15.75% recently, trading at ~$24.37, bolstered by whale accumulation totaling $50 million in a single day, per IntoTheBlock data. Large holders acquired ~2.05 million AVAX, signaling strong confidence despite a 5.2% weekly price dip. The buying spree aligns with AVAX’s robust on-chain activity, including a 169.9% surge in daily transactions and a 210.4% increase in active addresses, driven by projects like MapleStory N. Technical indicators show AVAX testing resistance at $27.38, with support at $23. A breakout could target $31, but a drop below $22 risks further declines. The Avalanche Foundation’s $50M Vista program for tokenized assets and partnerships with Alipay and California DMV enhance fundamentals. However, declining whale transaction volumes (down 65% for $100K-$1M trades) and market volatility pose risks to sustained momentum. Lower entry, higher ROI ceiling One of the primary reasons analysts favor Mutuum Finance (MUTM) over Avalanche (AVAX) right now is simple: upside potential. AVAX is a well-established Layer-1 protocol with a multibillion-dollar market cap. While that provides stability, it limits the room for explosive gains. Mutuum Finance (MUTM), on the other hand, is still in presale, giving early investors a rare shot at entering before a full public listing. With a listing price of $0.06 already set and forecasts suggesting a potential surge beyond $0.60 in the months after launch, early Phase 1 investors who bought in at $0.01 are already sitting on 3.5x gains before the token even hits exchanges. For those entering at Phase 6 pricing, there’s still an expected 70-100% return by listing on paper—just the beginning of what analysts believe could turn into a 10x to 20x return by Q4 2025. As capital continues to rotate into altcoins with real utility and token-linked revenue models, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) appears perfectly positioned. The project’s Tokenomics structure supports long-term sustainability. Out of a total supply of 4 billion tokens, only a fraction is being released in presale phases. In addition, a portion of protocol revenue will be used for regular MUTM buybacks, effectively controlling supply while redistributing value to mtToken stakers. This kind of built-in mechanic is rare in early-stage projects and is one of the key reasons bullish sentiment continues to rise. DeFi infrastructure with built-in growth loops Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is more than just a token—it’s the backbone of an emerging decentralized lending and stablecoin ecosystem. It introduces two core lending systems: Peer-to-Contract (P2C) and Peer-to-Peer (P2P). In the P2C model, users will deposit stablecoins or blue-chip tokens like USDT or ETH to earn dynamic interest rates based on pool utilization. These deposits will generate mtTokens in 1:1, which will not only reflect the user’s share in the pool but also increase in value as interest accrues. Lenders will be able to stake these mtTokens to receive additional MUTM rewards, which the protocol will buy back using platform revenue, creating a positive feedback loop of demand, staking, and growth. Borrowers, on the other hand, will gain access to overcollateralized loans based on a set Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio. For instance, a user will be able to deposit $10,000 worth of ETH and receive a loan of $6,000 in stablecoins, allowing them to retain exposure to their crypto while accessing liquidity. Lenders in these pools will earn up to 10–12% APY, depending on the utilization, while borrowers will benefit from flexible access to capital without needing to sell assets. The P2P model will add another layer of flexibility. Rather than relying on shared liquidity pools, users will negotiate lending terms directly, ideal for lesser-known or volatile tokens like memcoins, not supported by P2C contracts. While higher risk, this model will give more experienced users opportunities to optimize yields on their own terms. Stablecoin But the real game-changer will be the stablecoin component that Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is set to launch. Unlike traditional algorithmic models, this stablecoin will only be minted when loans are issued and will be automatically burned upon repayment, ensuring that supply expansion is always backed by value and demand. This system will be designed to maintain a 1:1 peg and will be deployed on a Layer-2 network for scalability and low fees. Security and transparency are also central to the platform’s rollout. A comprehensive audit by CertiK returned a Token Scan score of 95 and a Skynet rating of 78. The protocol is also running a $50,000 bug bounty campaign and a $100,000 giveaway , where 10 winners will receive $10,000 worth of MUTM each—both efforts highlighting a serious commitment to community trust and protocol resilience. While AVAX continues to attract large-scale buys, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is building to offer something AVAX cannot at this stage—early access to an emerging financial layer of DeFi. It’s a low market cap altcoin with a clear utility path and DeFi infrastructure that rewards participation. For investors looking to enter before the crowd, the window is still open—but not for long. title: Crypto Market Sell-off: Unveiling the Crucial Truth Behind Recent Price Drops
body: BitcoinWorld Crypto Market Sell-off: Unveiling the Crucial Truth Behind Recent Price Drops The cryptocurrency world often experiences dramatic price swings, and the recent dips in Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) were no exception. Many investors immediately wondered if this was another brutal liquidation cascade, a common culprit behind sharp downturns. However, fresh insights from leading on-chain analytics firm Glassnode reveal a different, and perhaps more reassuring, story about the true nature of this latest Crypto Market Sell-off . What Sparked the Recent Crypto Market Sell-off? Recent market movements saw Bitcoin drop by 3.2% and Ethereum slide by 6% within a 24-hour period. While these numbers might trigger alarm bells, the underlying mechanics suggest a less volatile scenario than some might assume. Glassnode’s report, shared on X, provided key data points that challenge the immediate assumption of a derivatives-led collapse: Limited Liquidations: Despite the price declines, forced liquidations for Bitcoin totaled only $110 million. For Ethereum, the figure was slightly higher at $132 million. These numbers are relatively low compared to past events where cascades reached hundreds of millions or even billions of dollars. Modest Open Interest Decline: Open interest, which represents the total number of outstanding derivatives contracts that have not been settled, saw only a modest decline. A significant drop in open interest often signals a large-scale deleveraging event, but that was not the case this time. This crucial distinction points towards a significant conclusion: the recent downturn was primarily prompted by spot-market sell orders. This means actual holders of BTC and ETH were selling their assets on exchanges, rather than leveraged traders being forcibly closed out of their positions. Understanding this difference is vital for anyone navigating the current Crypto Market Sell-off . Spot Selling vs. Liquidation Cascades: Why Does This Distinction Matter for the Crypto Market? The difference between a spot-driven sell-off and a derivatives-led liquidation cascade is fundamental to understanding market health and future trajectory. While both result in price drops, their implications are vastly different: Derivatives-Led Liquidation Cascades: These occur when highly leveraged positions are forced to close as prices move against them. This forced selling triggers more price drops, leading to more liquidations, creating a vicious cycle. Such events are often rapid, severe, and can cause widespread panic, as they indicate excessive risk-taking in the market. They clear out leverage quickly, often leading to sharp bounces afterward as the market becomes ‘cleaner’. Spot-Market Sell Orders: This type of selling happens when individuals or institutions directly sell their cryptocurrencies on exchanges. It reflects a more fundamental shift in sentiment or a desire to realize profits/losses. While it still drives prices down, it doesn’t carry the same systemic risk of a sudden, explosive deleveraging event. It suggests that holders are making conscious decisions to exit positions, rather than being forced out. The fact that the recent Crypto Market Sell-off was driven by spot sales suggests a more organic, albeit bearish, market correction. This reduces the likelihood of a sustained, leverage-driven downward spiral, offering a degree of stability compared to previous, more volatile market corrections. Feature Spot-Driven Sell-off Derivatives-Led Liquidation Cascade Primary Cause Direct selling of assets by holders Forced closure of leveraged positions Market Impact Gradual price decline, reflects bearish sentiment Rapid, sharp price drops, creates panic Risk Profile Lower systemic risk, less prone to chain reactions Higher systemic risk, potential for ‘death spirals’ Market Recovery Can be slower, dependent on sentiment shift Often followed by sharp bounce after deleveraging How Does On-Chain Data Provide Crucial Insights During a Crypto Market Sell-off? On-chain analytics firms like Glassnode play an indispensable role in providing transparency and depth to market analysis. By scrutinizing publicly available blockchain data, they can offer insights that traditional market indicators often miss. For instance, in the context of a Crypto Market Sell-off , they monitor: Exchange Netflows: Tracking whether more Bitcoin or Ethereum is moving onto or off exchanges. Inflows often precede selling pressure, while outflows can indicate accumulation. Whale Activity: Observing large transactions by significant holders (whales) can signal major shifts in market sentiment or impending large buy/sell orders. Realized Price and Profit/Loss: These metrics help identify at what price coins were last moved and whether current holders are in profit or loss, indicating potential selling pressure or support levels. Funding Rates: While open interest declined modestly, keeping an eye on funding rates in the derivatives market is always crucial. Negative funding rates can indicate a bearish bias among leveraged traders, but if they are not excessively negative, it suggests less immediate liquidation risk. These on-chain metrics collectively painted a picture of a market where underlying holders were making strategic decisions to sell, rather than a forced capitulation by over-leveraged speculators. This level of detail helps investors make more informed decisions during times of uncertainty and a significant Crypto Market Sell-off . What Are the Implications for Investors in the Wake of this Crypto Market Sell-off? For investors, the distinction between spot-driven selling and liquidation cascades carries significant implications for how they approach the market: Reduced Immediate Systemic Risk: The absence of a massive liquidation cascade means the market is not currently undergoing a widespread deleveraging event. This reduces the risk of a rapid, uncontrolled spiral often seen in highly leveraged markets. Underlying Bearish Sentiment: While not liquidation-driven, spot selling still indicates that a significant number of holders, or large entities, chose to sell their assets. This reflects a current bearish sentiment or a desire to take profits, suggesting that market conviction might be waning in the short term. Focus on Fundamental Drivers: With less leverage to clear, market movements are more likely to be influenced by macroeconomic factors, regulatory news, or project-specific developments. Investors should pivot their analysis towards these fundamental drivers rather than solely focusing on derivatives market health. Opportunity for Strategic Accumulation: For long-term investors, spot-driven pullbacks can present opportunities to accumulate assets at lower prices, especially if they believe in the long-term value proposition of Bitcoin and Ethereum. These dips are often seen as ‘healthier’ corrections than those caused by excessive leverage. This particular Crypto Market Sell-off provides a valuable lesson in market analysis, emphasizing the importance of looking beyond superficial price action to understand the true mechanics at play. It highlights that not all downturns are created equal. Concluding Thoughts on the Crypto Market Sell-off The recent price declines in Bitcoin and Ethereum, while unsettling for many, were primarily a result of spot-market selling rather than a catastrophic derivatives liquidation event. This crucial insight, provided by Glassnode’s on-chain analysis, suggests a more measured, albeit bearish, correction in the market. It indicates that the current Crypto Market Sell-off is driven by holders making deliberate choices, rather than a forced unwinding of risky positions. While the market may still face headwinds from broader economic factors or shifting sentiment, the absence of a leverage-induced cascade offers a degree of resilience. This understanding empowers investors to make more informed decisions, focusing on long-term conviction and fundamental analysis rather than reacting solely to short-term price volatility. As always, staying informed with reliable on-chain data and a balanced perspective remains paramount in navigating the dynamic world of cryptocurrencies. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What is a spot market sell-off? A spot market sell-off occurs when cryptocurrency holders directly sell their assets on exchanges at current market prices. It reflects a conscious decision by investors to exit positions, often due to profit-taking, risk aversion, or shifting sentiment. How does a spot market sell-off differ from a liquidation cascade? A spot market sell-off is driven by direct selling of assets, indicating a change in fundamental sentiment. A liquidation cascade, however, is triggered by forced closure of highly leveraged derivatives positions as prices move against traders, leading to rapid, severe price drops and often a ‘domino effect’ of further liquidations. What is ‘open interest’ in the context of cryptocurrency? Open interest refers to the total number of outstanding derivatives contracts (like futures or perpetual swaps) that have not yet been settled or closed. A high or rapidly increasing open interest can indicate significant leverage in the market, making it more susceptible to liquidation cascades. Does a spot-driven Crypto Market Sell-off mean the market is healthy? While it indicates a healthier market structure than a leverage-induced cascade, a spot-driven sell-off still signifies bearish sentiment or profit-taking by holders. It suggests a correction is underway, but without the immediate systemic risk associated with excessive leverage unwinding. What is Glassnode and why is its data important? Glassnode is an on-chain analytics firm that provides in-depth data and insights by analyzing public blockchain transactions. Its data is important because it offers transparency into market participants’ behavior, helping investors understand underlying trends, sentiment, and the true drivers of price movements beyond just exchange order books. Did you find this analysis helpful? Share this article with your friends and fellow crypto enthusiasts on social media to help them understand the true dynamics behind the latest Crypto Market Sell-off ! To learn more about the latest Crypto Market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin and Ethereum price market. This post Crypto Market Sell-off: Unveiling the Crucial Truth Behind Recent Price Drops first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Chinese video AI models expand globally
body: Chinese tech firms leverage the country’s vast video content market to deploy ads, film clips, and short-form videos automated by AI tools. Kling AI, developed by Kuaishou, a short video platform, ranks among the top players globally in converting text or still images into video content. According to Kuaishou, Kling AI is already used by more than 20,000 businesses, including advertisers and animation studios. At the recent World Artificial Intelligence Conference (WAIC) in Shanghai, Kling AI unveiled Kling 2.1, which can add sound effects to AI-generated visuals. Wei Xiong, Internet analyst at UBS Securities, revealed that AI video generation has the potential to reshape the content industry by enhancing production efficiency, reducing creative barriers, and unlocking new monetization models. Chinese startups challenge Google’s video AI tools with top models TikTok’s parent company, ByteDance , dominates the AI video model space. Artificial Analysis, an AI research firm, ranks ByteDance tools first and third among the top five text-to-video models released in the last two months. Google models ranked 2nd and 4th, while Kling AI ranked fifth. Wei Xiong believes Chinese firms are still early leaders in the field despite growing international competition. He acknowledged current limitations with AI-generated video, including clip length, motion consistency, and user control over output. Zeng Yushen, Kling AI’s head of operations, said the Kling AI model isn’t limited to domestic users. She added that international markets like Japan, South Korea, and Europe are gradually becoming key focus areas. She told CNBC in an exclusive interview that they have observed that big AI models are increasingly globalized, so people don’t care about the country of origin the product is from. Kling AI generated over 150 million yuan ($20.8 million) in revenue in the first quarter of 2025, and daily spending on the platform reached 30 million yuan during the same period. The company hasn’t revealed Q2 results yet, but it confirmed that users can subscribe to the tool and purchase credits to create videos. Yushen declined to disclose the cost of training Kling’s AI models. Vidu, a rival startup from Beijing Shengshu, was launched globally about a year ago. By March 2025, it projected $20 million in annual revenue via subscriptions. Chinese startups drive AI video innovation across multiple industries Triolo, a partner at an advisory firm, noted that Chinese firms are applying the AI video tools across various industries. The startups identify pain points that companies are willing to pay to solve, leading to more effective AI applications. He cited 3DStyle, a Chinese startup that uses AI to design clothing styles and integrate them into automated, internet-connected manufacturing. Amazon, Google, and Microsoft also actively participate in the AI video tools industry. OpenAI unveiled its video generator Sora to ChatGPT users in December last year, almost a year after revealing the model. Kling AI went public in June 2024 ahead of Sora despite the early reveal. This week, Alibaba introduced Wan 2.2 , the latest version of its video generation model. Wan 2.2 can control lighting, time of day, frame size, and camera angles. Wan is open-source and has been downloaded 5.4 million times since February from Hugging Face and China’s ModelScope platforms. Tencent recently launched Hunyuan World, which uses mesh-based 3D generation for game development. Daniel Ahmad from Niko partners revealed that the model supports Tencent’s game teams and reflects its goal of leading in game development. Niko partners revealed that over half of China’s game studios use AI to cut costs and development time. However, Ahmad warned that poor integration with AI-generated content may cause backlash in some cases. Your crypto news deserves attention - KEY Difference Wire puts you on 250+ top sites

title: Crucial OSMO Mainnet Upgrade: Bithumb Announces Temporary Suspension
body: BitcoinWorld Crucial OSMO Mainnet Upgrade: Bithumb Announces Temporary Suspension Attention all cryptocurrency enthusiasts and Osmosis (OSMO) token holders! A significant development is on the horizon for the Osmosis ecosystem, directly impacting how you interact with your OSMO assets on certain platforms. South Korean crypto exchange Bithumb has made an important announcement regarding the upcoming OSMO Mainnet Upgrade , which will necessitate a temporary suspension of OSMO deposits and withdrawals. Understanding the implications of this event is crucial for ensuring the safety and accessibility of your digital assets. What Does the OSMO Mainnet Upgrade Entail? For those new to the world of blockchain, a mainnet upgrade is a fundamental improvement to a blockchain’s core infrastructure. Think of it like a major software update for your computer, but on a much grander scale, affecting the entire network. The upcoming OSMO Mainnet Upgrade is designed to enhance the Osmosis blockchain’s performance, security, and functionality. These upgrades are vital for the long-term health and scalability of any decentralized network. Osmosis itself is a decentralized exchange (DEX) built within the Cosmos ecosystem, known for its interchain liquidity and customizable liquidity pools. Its native token, OSMO, plays a central role in governance, staking, and transaction fees within the network. Therefore, any upgrade to its underlying mainnet directly impacts the utility and future potential of the OSMO token. Typically, mainnet upgrades aim to introduce: Improved Scalability: Enabling the network to handle more transactions faster. Enhanced Security: Patching vulnerabilities and strengthening network defenses. New Features: Introducing new functionalities or improving existing ones for developers and users. Network Stability: Ensuring the blockchain operates smoothly and reliably. Why the Temporary Suspension of OSMO Deposits and Withdrawals? Bithumb’s decision to temporarily suspend OSMO deposits and withdrawals, effective 09:00 UTC on August 5, is a standard and necessary procedure during major blockchain upgrades. This action is taken to safeguard user assets and ensure a seamless transition to the upgraded network. Imagine trying to update a critical system while it’s still actively processing data; it could lead to errors or data loss. The same principle applies here. During a mainnet upgrade, there’s a risk of transactions being processed on the old chain version, which might become incompatible with the new one. This could lead to: Lost Transactions: Funds sent or withdrawn during the upgrade might not be recognized on the new chain. Data Inconsistencies: Discrepancies between user balances on the exchange and the actual blockchain state. Security Risks: Potential vulnerabilities if the exchange attempts to interact with a network in transition. By halting these services, Bithumb ensures that all OSMO transactions are processed on the stable, upgraded network once the transition is complete. This protective measure is a sign of a responsible exchange prioritizing user security and asset integrity during the OSMO Mainnet Upgrade . What Should OSMO Holders Do Before the OSMO Mainnet Upgrade? For all OSMO holders on Bithumb, proactive steps are essential. While the suspension is temporary, understanding the timeline and preparing your assets accordingly is vital. Here’s a quick guide: Action Item Description Recommendation Check Announcement Details Verify the exact suspension time (09:00 UTC, Aug. 5) on Bithumb’s official website. Confirm all dates and times to avoid last-minute issues. Plan Deposits/Withdrawals Complete any necessary OSMO deposits or withdrawals well before the announced suspension time. Allow ample time for transactions to clear, especially if network congestion is expected. Monitor Bithumb Updates Stay informed about Bithumb’s official communications regarding the upgrade’s progress and service resumption. Follow their official channels (website, social media) for real-time information. It is important to remember that while deposits and withdrawals are paused, trading of OSMO on Bithumb will likely continue as normal, unless otherwise specified by the exchange. The suspension is specific to the movement of tokens onto and off the exchange, not their internal trading. The Broader Impact: Mainnet Upgrades and the Crypto Ecosystem The OSMO Mainnet Upgrade is not an isolated event. Mainnet upgrades are a regular occurrence in the dynamic cryptocurrency space. They are a testament to the continuous innovation and development within blockchain projects. Just as traditional software requires updates to remain competitive and secure, so do decentralized networks. These upgrades are crucial for driving adoption, improving user experience, and ensuring the long-term viability of blockchain technology. For exchanges like Bithumb, supporting these upgrades is a complex process. It involves extensive testing, coordination with the blockchain development team, and careful management of user funds. Their role is to act as a secure bridge between users and the underlying blockchain, ensuring that even during significant technical transitions, user assets remain safe and accessible once services resume. The challenges involved in mainnet upgrades include: Coordination: Ensuring all network participants (nodes, validators, exchanges) are ready for the upgrade. Downtime Management: Minimizing the impact on users by clearly communicating suspension periods. Bug Resolution: Being prepared to address any unforeseen technical issues that may arise during or after the upgrade. A conceptual image of a blockchain upgrade with data flowing smoothly. Ensuring a Smooth Transition: The Role of Exchanges and Users Exchanges play a pivotal role in facilitating smooth transitions during events like the OSMO Mainnet Upgrade . They are responsible for upgrading their infrastructure to be compatible with the new blockchain version, ensuring that user balances are correctly migrated, and resuming services only when the network is stable and secure. This commitment to operational excellence is what builds trust within the crypto community. For users, the primary responsibility lies in staying informed and adhering to official announcements. Avoiding last-minute transactions and being patient during the suspension period are key. Once services resume, it is always a good practice to verify your balances and ensure everything is in order. If you encounter any issues, contacting Bithumb’s customer support should be your first step. The successful execution of an OSMO Mainnet Upgrade benefits everyone: For Osmosis: Improved network performance, new capabilities, and enhanced competitiveness. For OSMO Holders: A more robust and valuable asset, potentially leading to increased utility and adoption. For the Crypto Ecosystem: Demonstrates the continuous evolution and resilience of decentralized technologies. Conclusion: Navigating the OSMO Mainnet Upgrade with Confidence The temporary suspension of OSMO deposits and withdrawals by Bithumb is a standard and necessary procedure to support the upcoming OSMO Mainnet Upgrade . This event, far from being a cause for concern, signifies a positive step forward for the Osmosis blockchain, promising enhanced performance and security. By staying informed, planning your transactions in advance, and monitoring official communications from Bithumb, you can navigate this period with confidence. This upgrade underscores the continuous development in the blockchain space, aiming to deliver more efficient and secure decentralized services to users worldwide. Embrace these advancements as they pave the way for a more robust and capable decentralized future. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: Why is Bithumb suspending OSMO deposits and withdrawals? A1: Bithumb is suspending these services to support the upcoming OSMO Mainnet Upgrade . This is a standard procedure to ensure the safety of user assets and a smooth transition to the new, improved blockchain network. Q2: When will the suspension of OSMO deposits and withdrawals begin? A2: The temporary suspension for OSMO deposits and withdrawals on Bithumb is scheduled to begin at 09:00 UTC on August 5. Q3: Can I still trade OSMO on Bithumb during the suspension? A3: Typically, only deposits and withdrawals are affected during such upgrades. Trading of OSMO on Bithumb is expected to continue as normal unless Bithumb announces otherwise. Always check their official announcements for the most accurate information. Q4: What should I do if I need to deposit or withdraw OSMO? A4: It is strongly recommended to complete any necessary OSMO deposits or withdrawals well before the announced suspension time of 09:00 UTC on August 5 to avoid any complications. Q5: How long will the suspension last? A5: The duration of the suspension will depend on the completion of the OSMO Mainnet Upgrade and Bithumb’s internal testing. Bithumb will issue another announcement once deposits and withdrawals are ready to resume. Q6: Is my OSMO safe on Bithumb during the upgrade? A6: Yes, Bithumb implements these suspensions precisely to protect user assets during critical network upgrades. Your OSMO held on the exchange remains secure, and services will resume once the upgrade is successfully implemented and verified. Did you find this article informative? Share it with your friends and fellow crypto enthusiasts on social media to help them stay informed about the crucial OSMO Mainnet Upgrade and how it impacts their assets! To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping the Osmosis ecosystem’s future growth. title: With Ethereum (ETH) at $3,700, Is It Too Late to Buy? Some Analysts Prefer Mutuum Finance (MUTM) at $0.035 Instead

Simultaneously, the protocol allows borrowers to access up to 65% of their collateral value — in this case, $1,300 in USDC — while retaining exposure to the original asset. Repayment is fully flexible, with no mandatory due dates, which aligns well with market volatility cycles. Meanwhile, the P2P lending model expands the protocol’s reach by allowing direct user-to-user lending agreements. This is tailored for users who want to lend or borrow less conventional assets outside of the shared liquidity pools, often in exchange for higher yields or risk-adjusted terms. This flexible architecture positions Mutuum Finance (MUTM) as a comprehensive lending engine in the DeFi space. Unlike many yield protocols, the platform doesn’t stop at interest earnings. Users receive mtTokens (like mtETH or mtUSDT) 1:1 upon deposit, which automatically appreciate as yield accumulates. These mtTokens can also be staked in dedicated smart contracts to earn MUTM rewards — creating a layered yield system that encourages long-term users and consistent ecosystem participation. Its smart contracts and codebase have been reviewed by leading security firm CertiK, with a Token Score of 95 and a Skynet security rating of 78. A $50,000 bug bounty program is live, ensuring continual scrutiny and hardening of the ecosystem. The roadmap is already unfolding: presale infrastructure, marketing deployment, and CertiK auditing were all key milestones of Phase 1, now reportedly mostly completed. The soon-to-launch decentralized stablecoin will be minted at loan issuance and burned upon repayment, ensuring supply control and zero inflation — a stark difference from algorithmic failures seen in previous DeFi cycles.
